title: Don't book with SpiceJet; they cancel tickets.
text: Avoid booking with SpiceJet if you want a hassle-free travel experience. Many passengers have reported frequent ticket cancellations, often at the last minute, causing unnecessary stress and inconvenience. Their refund process can be slow and frustrating, leaving travelers stranded without proper compensation. Customer service is often unresponsive, making it difficult to resolve issues efficiently. While their fares may seem attractive, the risk of sudden cancellations outweighs the benefits. If you need a reliable airline, consider other options with a better track record for honoring bookings. Save yourself the trouble and choose an airline that prioritizes customer satisfaction.

title: At Spice Jet, the military term shines brightly - SNAFU: situation normal: all f**ked up.
text:
SNAFU with Spice Jet:

At Spice Jet, the military term shines brightly - SNAFU: situation normal: all f**ked up.

Ticket was booked Jan 14th, later a boarding pass generated on their website.
On the day of flight 2/4, airline staff said that you canceled your check-in on 1/28?
I was forced to be bumped to the next flight by them doing me a favor as the one canceled my own flight though they issued a boarding pass to me already.
When I asked how that would be even possible, they flash a screen saying that a cancellation was made in 1:28, so their system records me as ‚Äúni Show‚Äù. That‚Äôs a week before this flight which is a short 1.5 hours flight.  A No Show for a flight a week later in order to sell my ticket.
I took a photo of their screen as what they were flashing me with made no sense.  I was sternly asked to delete the photo by multiple people at the gate.

What really happened: 
The flight was getting full near the end of January, they raised the price significantly, and canceled some tickets.  But there is notification and any compensation, just a fall blame on a full paying and diligent customer with ticket and boarding pass in hand.

There are several standing by holding more expensive tickets behind me who all got on the flights.  And more than 1 person confirmed that it is a full flight.

If there was any doubt about their scheme, what happened next eliminated all suspicion that it is an error, or negligence. It was deliberate.  They offered me another flight 7 hours later.  I had to accept it in order to travel. And the replacement ticket is already made!  There was a person on the phone with the boarding gate desk throughout the whole process. The moment they offered and I accepted a forced delay, the ‚Äúticket‚Äù in the form of a screenshot on the gate attendance‚Äôs mobile phone appeared.  They have all along prepared this option after their decision to over book and keep higher prices purchases and bump people off without refund or any perks or compensation.  I‚Äôd rather they are honest to ask me to pay extra and save the 7 hours wait; not to mention all the changes I have to make for the day.  Their attitudes and blaming on customers they deliberately cheated made the whole fiasco even more difficult.

At Spice Jet, the military term shines brightly - SNAFU: situation normal: all F**ked up.

title: SpiceJet ‚Äì The Absolute Worst Airline! Stay Away!
text:
SpiceJet ‚Äì The Absolute Worst Airline! Stay Away!

If I could give negative stars, I would. SpiceJet is by far the most pathetic excuse for an airline I have ever encountered. Their Delhi airport staff, especially the so-called ‚Äúmanager,‚Äù is unbelievably rude, uncooperative, and full of arrogance, acting like they‚Äôre paying us to fly instead of the other way around.

First, they randomly canceled my flight with some ridiculous excuse, causing unnecessary stress and inconvenience. To make matters worse, they didn‚Äôt even refund my money! No proper explanation, no customer support‚Äîjust a blatant scam to rob passengers of their hard-earned money.

And if that wasn‚Äôt enough, when I finally booked another flight, I arrived just two minutes late for luggage check-in (with still a full hour before takeoff!), yet they flat-out refused to let me board. No empathy, no professionalism‚Äîjust a bunch of rude staff enjoying making passengers suffer.

SpiceJet is the definition of a third-class airline. Their customer service is nonexistent, their management is a joke, and their attitude is disgusting. Do yourself a favor and NEVER book with them. They don‚Äôt deserve a single penny from anyone!

title: Outstanding Experience aboard SpiceJet
text:
Dear SpiceJet,
I am a doctor in the Indian Air Force and have always enjoyed flying SpiceJet! The recent trip of mine from Kolkata to Bengaluru [SG 518] on 26 Jan was indeed an awesome experience. The flight was late due to weather but the intimations were done well in time. The checjk-in staff was courteous and professional. The seats of the aircraft were very comfortable- Rarely seen in the other airlines these days! The in-flight experience was just super! The cabin attendants were in the attire befitting the Republic Day and were truly perfect their service with a smile and forthcoming nature. My request for a warm beverage in lieu of the soft drink was acceded to with no resistance! Please convey the compliments to the staff! The landing by Captain Rajiv Mohan was a 10/10!!! One of the finest landing experiences in the recent times off my travel- Ultimate smooth touchdown! C'mon, SpiceJet- Push your services more frequently and let more passengers have the experience of flying in comfort! Looking forward to flying again with SpiceJet!
Regards,

title: Intimidation and Harassment by SpiceJet Ground Staff
text:
I had an extremely distressing experience with SpiceJet during the boarding process for my flight (PNR: HBB72M). One of their ground staff members, who identified himself as Mr. Vinay, subjected me to unwarranted harassment, intimidation, and threats, despite my willingness to comply and pay the required baggage charges.

Here‚Äôs a summary of what I endured:

Weight Discrepancy and Lack of Proof: My hand luggage was 6 kg over the limit, as I observed on the scale. However, Mr. Vinay insisted it was 7 kg without providing any proof. When I questioned this, he rudely dismissed me and told me to ‚Äútalk to SpiceJet later‚Äù because ‚Äúhis decision was final.‚Äù

Dismissal of Reasonable Solutions: I offered to check in one of my bags to adhere to the baggage rules, but Mr. Vinay refused and stated it was ‚Äúnot his responsibility.‚Äù

Threats of Denied Boarding: Despite my cooperation and readiness to pay, Mr. Vinay repeatedly threatened, ‚ÄúI will not allow you to board the flight,‚Äù as if he was doing me a favor by even engaging in the conversation.

Hostile and Intimidating Language: At one point, Mr. Vinay warned me that I would be reported to the DGCA and would receive calls from security upon landing. He even claimed he could ban me from flying with SpiceJet in the future.

Unnecessary Escalation: After issuing a receipt for the additional baggage charges, he refused my request to document the excess weight on the receipt. When I requested to read the receipt before signing, he threatened me again with ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to board the flight then.‚Äù

TripAdvisor Review: Intimidation and Harassment by SpiceJet Ground Staff
I had an extremely distressing experience with SpiceJet during the boarding process for my flight (PNR: HBB72M). One of their ground staff members, who identified himself as Mr. Vinay, subjected me to unwarranted harassment, intimidation, and threats, despite my willingness to comply and pay the required baggage charges.

Here‚Äôs a summary of what I endured:

Weight Discrepancy and Lack of Proof: My hand luggage was 6 kg over the limit, as I observed on the scale. However, Mr. Vinay insisted it was 7 kg without providing any proof. When I questioned this, he rudely dismissed me and told me to ‚Äútalk to SpiceJet later‚Äù because ‚Äúhis decision was final.‚Äù

Dismissal of Reasonable Solutions: I offered to check in one of my bags to adhere to the baggage rules, but Mr. Vinay refused and stated it was ‚Äúnot his responsibility.‚Äù

Threats of Denied Boarding: Despite my cooperation and readiness to pay, Mr. Vinay repeatedly threatened, ‚ÄúI will not allow you to board the flight,‚Äù as if he was doing me a favor by even engaging in the conversation.

Hostile and Intimidating Language: At one point, Mr. Vinay warned me that I would be reported to the DGCA and would receive calls from security upon landing. He even claimed he could ban me from flying with SpiceJet in the future.

Unnecessary Escalation: After issuing a receipt for the additional baggage charges, he refused my request to document the excess weight on the receipt. When I requested to read the receipt before signing, he threatened me again with ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to board the flight then.‚Äù

Inconsistent Payment Options: Initially, he demanded payment via card only, despite my readiness to pay through UPI. This lack of flexibility further added to the frustration.

This entire experience felt like an orchestrated attempt to humiliate and intimidate me. The staff member used aggressive and condescending language, turning a routine process into a nightmare.

Key Questions for SpiceJet:

Why was I, a cooperative passenger, subjected to such degrading treatment?
What breach of security did I allegedly commit to warrant threats of DGCA involvement and security scrutiny?
Why did the staff refuse to provide proof of the claimed excess weight and dismiss my suggestions for resolution?
This level of unprofessionalism is shocking. While SpiceJet issued just an apology mail in response to my complaint, no corrective action was mentioned, nor was any compensation offered for the distress caused. Passengers should not have to tolerate this kind of behavior from airline staff.

title: Bad customer service.
text:
My recent experience with SpiceJet - SG330 - A78IJL - Saturday 25th January 5:40pm from Varanasi  was quite uncomfortable due to excessive noise throughout the journey. To make matters worse, we purchased food onboard, but when the spoon accidentally slipped from my hand, I requested a replacement from the flight attendant. To my surprise, they outright denied having any extra spoons and responded in a rude manner. I was left wondering how I was supposed to eat without a spoon. Eventually, the steward brought one from inside, but the air hostess gave unpleasant expressions and commented, ‚ÄúOh, you got the spoon from our meals,‚Äù which felt unnecessarily rude and unprofessional.

It‚Äôs baffling that a flight charging such significant fares cannot provide basic items like extra spoons. This reflects poorly on their customer service and etiquette, which were severely lacking during this journey.

title: Worst Experience of my lIfe
text:
I recently traveled with this airline and had a terrible experience from start to finish. The flight was delayed by 2 hours, and after finally boarding, passengers were made to wait for an additional hour inside the plane. The boarding process was chaotic and disorganized, making the entire situation frustrating from the very beginning.

Once on the plane, the seats were uncomfortable, and the cleanliness was appalling. It was clear that the cabin had not been properly cleaned prior to boarding.

To make matters worse, after landing, my luggage was missing. The airline staff informed us that it had been left behind, but they couldn't provide any clear timeline for when it would be returned. When I asked for more details, the staff was unhelpful and vague, giving me a range of "maybe" dates with no firm commitment.

The staff's attitude was the most concerning. They were rude and dismissive when I inquired about the delay and the missing luggage. One staff member even told me, "I can see the weather, don't disturb us." It felt as though the staff had no regard for passengers' concerns and were simply going through the motions without any genuine care for the guests.

This experience has left me extremely disappointed. I would strongly advise others to consider other options when booking a flight with this airline. There is a serious lack of professionalism and customer care.

title: Unprofessional  and Unethical Airline
text:
Mishandling of Checked Baggage by SpiceJet

On January 6, I travelled from Dubai to Mumbai on a SpiceJet flight, with an onward connection to Udaipur (via Indigo Airlines)  later the same day after a layover of seven hours. I checked in my baggage at Dubai Airport well before the mandatory two-hour deadline.  Upon arrival, my checked baggage did not arrive at Mumbai Airport.

I approached a SpiceJet staff member, who informed me that my bag had been left behind in Dubai. They assured me it would be sent on the next flight scheduled for the evening of January 6. Based on their recommendation, I rescheduled my onward flight to Udaipur for the following day, January 7, incurring additional charges of Rs 4960 that they promised could be reimbursed. Unfortunately, the baggage did not arrive on the subsequent flight either, and I had to proceed to Udaipur without it.

What followed was a distressing experience involving repeated attempts to trace my baggage. Over the next four days, I made approximately 20 to 25 calls to SpiceJet‚Äôs helpdesk, which appeared completely uninformed about the status of my luggage. Eventually, my bag was located in Calicut, Kerala. Despite my request to have it delivered to Mumbai, the airline inexplicably sent the bag back to Dubai. After further delays and persistent follow-ups, my baggage was finally delivered to Mumbai five days after my arrival.

This experience was deeply disappointing due to the airline‚Äôs lack of professionalism, poor communication, and inability to handle the situation efficiently. SpiceJet‚Äôs service throughout this ordeal was unacceptable, and I strongly advise against choosing this airline for travel.

Avoid SpiceJet at all costs!

title: Baggage got opened and valuable are missing
text:
This is to bring you into notice that I had planned to go on a vacation in December. I have taken the SG-59 Flight which is from BOM to DXB. We have done the baggage check-in. We have onboarded the flight. 
While collecting the Baggage from Belt number 3 in DXB. We collected and added in the trolley. 

But when we reached the hotel and at that time, when I was trying to open one of the suitcases. I saw that the 3-digit code for that luggage was reset to 0-0-0. Then Immediately I took videos and photos of the luggage. Because the lock which I have set in Mumbai was different. 

 I am extremely disappointed with the handling of my baggage. Upon arrival, I discovered that my luggage had been opened and tampered with. This is not only unacceptable but also highly concerning for the safety and security of passengers‚Äô belongings.

I saw that the complete luggage was checked by some member in the airport(Baggage Team). It was opened by someone, he has checked each and every cloth and some valuable item is missing from the bag. I have raised the complaint on custrelations@spicejet.com. It's been 13 days I have not got the revert yet. My concern is how come the ground staff who is carrying the luggage from check-in to flight can open the bag in the middle while carrying it. title: Our Unforgettable (FOR ALL THE WRONG REASONS) Experience with SpiceJet
text:
Ah, SpiceJet. Where to even begin? We had the misfortune of booking our tickets to Port Blair from Delhi via Chennai with this airline. Let‚Äôs just say it turned out to be one of the worst flying experiences of our lives‚Äîand we‚Äôve flown budget before, so that‚Äôs saying something.

Act I: The Delayed Departure
We left Port Blair on January 3rd, an hour and a half behind schedule because the flight‚Äôs arrival was delayed. Annoying, but manageable. Instead of landing in Delhi at the promised 11 PM, we found ourselves in Delhi‚Äôs airspace sometime after midnight. Then came the announcement: due to heavy fog in Delhi, the flight would be diverted to Jaipur. Most passengers, including us, understood this‚Äîit‚Äôs weather; what can you do?

But what followed was a masterclass in how to not handle a situation.

Act II: Chaos in Jaipur
‚Ä¢ After landing in Jaipur, we stayed on the tarmac for an unnecessarily long time. Just to keep things exciting, of course.

‚Ä¢ Then came Announcement #1: ‚ÄúPlease collect your luggage and disembark.‚Äù Dutifully, everyone stood up, gathered their cabin baggage, and prepared to exit. But wait! Announcement #2 swooped in moments later, telling us to sit down again‚Äîwith no explanation whatsoever.

‚Ä¢ And then‚Ä¶ radio silence. For two whole hours. NEITHER THE CAPTAIN NOR THE CABIN CREW OR GROUND STAFF FELT IT NECESSARY TO PROVIDE A SINGLE UPDATE. The ground staff? Nowhere to be found. Maybe they were on vacation.

Act III: A Comedy of Errors (If It Weren‚Äôt So Infuriating)
‚Ä¢ My nephew, feeling sick before landing in Jaipur, was met with a delightful surprise: no airsick bags in the seat pockets. None. Anywhere. WHAT KIND OF AIRLINE SKIMPS ON AIRSICK BAGS?

‚Ä¢ After two hours of passengers silently fuming, some brave souls finally started asking questions. Only then did the ground staff emerge like mythical creatures from a long-forgotten legend.

‚Ä¢ The cherry on top? The crew began refueling the aircraft, which would have been fine if they didn‚Äôt subject us to a series of cringe-worthy, subpar announcements about it.

Finally, after three long hours, we were informed that the flight was canceled because‚Äîwait for it‚Äîthe cabin crew had exceeded their duty hours. They had three hours to figure this out, but apparently, basic math isn‚Äôt a SpiceJet strength.

Act IV: A Medical Emergency and the Final Insult
‚Ä¢ After disembarking, my sick nephew had a seizure on the cold tarmac and had to be attended to right there. And what was SpiceJet‚Äôs staff doing during this distressing scene? Standing around like spectators at a sports game. I have pictures to prove their utter uselessness.

‚Ä¢ Despite having three hours to prepare, the airline had not even managed to set up a helpdesk for stranded passengers. Brilliant planning, truly.

By the time we collected our luggage and left the airport, we‚Äôd given up expecting any semblance of help or responsibility from this airline.

To SpiceJet Management and Ground Staff:
SHAME ON YOU, SPICEJET!!!
You‚Äôve set a new standard for how not to treat your customers. Your complete lack of professionalism, compassion, and basic competence is nothing short of shameful.

A Word to Fellow Travelers:
Avoid SpiceJet like the plague. Seriously. Spend a little more and fly with an airline that knows how to take care of its passengers. Trust me, you‚Äôll thank yourself later.

title: Terrible Experience with SpiceJet Flight Management and Cabin Crew
text:
I am writing this review to express my utter disappointment with SpiceJet's abysmal level of service, which has left me frustrated and deeply dissatisfied.

Incident Overview:

Upon boarding the flight, I discovered that the check-in gates were closed 30 minutes before departure, leaving passengers scrambling to make it on time without clear instructions or assistance from the ground staff.
To make matters worse, when I landed at my destination, my baggage did not arrive on the conveyor belt.
Follow-Up Nightmare:

I followed up multiple times with SpiceJet's management and customer service regarding the missing baggage. I was informed that my baggage would arrive on the next flight to Mumbai at 10 PM on January 6th.
However, after waiting beyond 10 PM, the baggage still didn‚Äôt arrive. Upon contacting customer service yet again, the response I received was nothing short of shocking:
"We don‚Äôt really know much about it."

Eventually, I was informed that my baggage was declared lost, leaving me stranded without my belongings and without the airline's accountability.
Unacceptable Service:
This level of negligence is beyond disgraceful for an airline that claims to serve passengers professionally. It is unacceptable that:

The baggage was not loaded onto the flight, reflecting the cabin crew's and ground staff's complete failure.
The customer service team provided conflicting and unhelpful information, adding to the frustration.
No compensation or proper resolution was offered for the lost baggage, leaving me to bear the financial and emotional burden.
Call for Action:
Stringent action must be taken against the flight management and cabin crew responsible for this mishandling. It is unacceptable for passengers to endure such incompetence and lack of accountability. This experience has severely eroded my trust in SpiceJet, and I will actively discourage others from using this airline unless significant improvements are made.

Conclusion:
SpiceJet's service was terrible, disgraceful, and indicative of a broader failure in customer care and operational efficiency. I demand an immediate investigation into this matter and appropriate compensation for my ordeal. Passengers deserve much better than this appalling level of service. I shall be taking Strict action against the flight management for this disgraceful experience; I highly urge people to avoid travelling on this substandard low-cost airline with such an unacceptable level of customer service. Instead, I would recommend alternative airlines to travel

Best Regards

title: The worst airline to exit with horrible customer care service
text:
I had initially booked a SpiceJet flight from Kochi to Chennai on January 4th, 2024, with a departure time of 9:20 PM. However, the airline later rescheduled the flight multiple times‚Äîto 10:35 PM and then again to 11:20 PM, which pushed the arrival time in Chennai to 12:40 AM. This was highly inconvenient for me, as traveling alone and arranging transportation at such a late hour would be challenging. Given that the rescheduling exceeded two hours, I was entitled to reschedule my flight, which I chose to do for January 5th, 2024, on their 8:40 AM flight.

On the morning of January 5th, as I prepared for my journey, I was shocked to learn that this flight had been canceled and rescheduled for January 7th, 2024‚Äîan unacceptable delay of two days. This change caused extreme inconvenience, as I had commitments scheduled for January 6th, 2024, that I could not miss. I had paid a significant amount for this booking and did not anticipate this level of disruption.

When I contacted SpiceJet‚Äôs customer care to inquire about the cancellation, I was initially told that it was due to weather conditions. However, other airlines operating on the same route were unaffected. Later, I was informed it was a scheduling error, raising questions about the airline‚Äôs transparency and operational competence. I was given only two options: reschedule the flight for January 7th or cancel my booking altogether. Given my commitments, I was forced to opt for cancellation.

Adding to my frustration, upon checking the booking app later, I discovered there was a SpiceJet flight departing on January 5th at 9:20 PM, with available seats. Despite this, I was never offered the option to fly on that flight, which was not only unfair but also indicated a serious lapse in customer care. When I brought this to the attention of SpiceJet‚Äôs customer care, I was informed that the cancellation could not be reversed, essentially blaming me for the decision, despite their failure to provide me with all possible options in the first place.

The customer service experience was appalling. The wait times were excessively long, and my request to speak to a senior staff member was repeatedly denied. I was told that seniors would only be available at 12 PM, forcing me to call back later. Even when I did, I had to repeat my entire ordeal to another representative, only to be denied access to a senior once more. I was eventually promised a callback at 1:30 PM, but this entire ordeal demonstrated a complete lack of professionalism and accountability on the part of SpiceJet‚Äôs customer service team.

This experience raises serious concerns about the airline‚Äôs commitment to customer satisfaction and its operational integrity. It almost feels like a deliberate ploy to inconvenience passengers, potentially pushing them toward cancellations and higher-priced rebookings‚Äîan exploitative practice that borders on a scam. The lack of transparency, the unwillingness to provide reasonable solutions, and the irresponsible behavior of senior staff at the customer care center all point to systemic failures in the company‚Äôs operations.

When a senior staff member, Mr. Mohan Kumar, finally contacted me, I pointed out the apparent exploitation of passengers through cancellations and the lack of proper alternatives, which seemed to compel customers to purchase higher-priced tickets. His response was shockingly dismissive and rude: ‚ÄúYou probably shouldn‚Äôt fly our airline if you can‚Äôt afford it.‚Äù Another senior employee, Ms. Neha Bharadwaj, displayed similarly unprofessional behavior, further compounding my dissatisfaction with the airline‚Äôs customer service standards
As a consumer, I demand compensation for the inconvenience caused, the stress of managing alternative arrangements, and the lack of proper resolution to my concerns. 

Additionally, SpiceJet must address its poor customer care service, improve its transparency, and ensure that passengers are provided with all available options during disruptions. The blame for this fiasco lies solely with the airline, and it is unacceptable to shift this burden onto the passengers who have placed their trust in the company.

title: Never book this flight
text:
I had an extremely disappointing experience with SpiceJet. My flight from Chennai to Cochin (SG 2703) on 10/12/2024 was canceled at the last minute without any prior notice or proper explanation. My recent SpiceJet flight from Srinagar to Bangalore was a nightmare. The flight was delayed by over 3 hours and 40 minutes, with no refreshments provided. 

After finally departing, the layover flight (Delhi) to Bangalore had a non-functioning cooling system for over an hour, making it extremely uncomfortable for passengers.

Despite repeated requests, the only response from the crew was to "be patient." This is completely unacceptable service, especially considering the price of airfare.

I will be filing a formal complaint with SpiceJet and strongly advise others to consider alternative airlines. This experience has definitely discouraged me from ever flying with SpiceJet again.

Flight Number - SG8151

Route - Srinagar - Delhi - Bangalore

title: Extremely Disappointing Experience with SpiceJet after Flight Cancellation Flight Cancelled
text:
Extremely Disappointing Experience with SpiceJet

I was scheduled to fly on flight SG231 from Delhi to Khajuraho on October 26, 2024, but the flight was canceled more than two hours after the scheduled departure time. To make matters worse, no refreshments were provided during the long wait at the airport. Although the staff promised compensation, I have yet to receive any follow-up. I have sent multiple emails to SpiceJet‚Äôs Customer Relations team and escalated the matter to the Appellate Authority, but they continue to manipulate the situation and give contradictory responses regarding the flight cancellation.

There were over 80 passengers booked on the same flight, all of whom can attest to the fact that the flight was indeed canceled. Despite this, SpiceJet has failed to offer any meaningful support or resolution.

I am still waiting for my refund, which has been pending for 25 days now. As of today, November 20, 2024, I am thoroughly disappointed and frustrated by this experience. SpiceJet has been the worst airline experience I‚Äôve ever had, and I would strongly advise others to reconsider flying with them.

title: Charge for carrying duty free shopping

title: WORST REVIEW EVER!!
text:
The worst flight service experience ever! We had originally booked a direct evening flight from Ahmedabad to Pune and planned our 2-day hotel stay accordingly. However, the airline cancelled our flight and rescheduled it to an inconvenient 3 AM slot, wasting one entire day of our hotel booking.

To make matters worse, instead of offering another direct flight, they gave us a frustrating itinerary with multiple connecting flights, which kept getting delayed at every step:

Ahmedabad to Goa, originally scheduled for 5:55 AM, was delayed to 7:05 AM.
Goa to Pune, originally scheduled for 1:55 PM, was delayed to 2:55 PM and then further to 4:20 PM.
This meant we were stranded at the Goa airport for over 5-6 hours, completely disrupting our plans. They wasted our hotel booking, our time, and caused unnecessary stress and frustration. Hands down, the worst flight experience ever!

title: Harrowing experience with Spicejet airlines
text:
Complaint Regarding SpiceJet Flights SG 8521 and SG 8174

On October 17, 2024, my wife and I embarked on what we hoped would be a seamless journey from New Delhi to Kolkata aboard SpiceJet flight SG 8521. Unfortunately, our experience was anything but smooth.

Initially directed to Gate 42C, we, as senior citizens, painstakingly made our way there, only to find ourselves waiting indefinitely. Despite our vigilant observation of the flight information screens, our flight number was conspicuously absent. To our dismay, announcements for flights scheduled after ours began to appear, heightening our anxiety.

In a state of growing concern, we desperately sought out SpiceJet personnel or a service booth to clarify the situation. However, there was no representative in sight, and even the police personnel were unable to assist. Attempts to reach SpiceJet via their helpline proved futile as the number was non-functional.

Salvation came in the unlikely form of an airline cleaner, who advised us to proceed to Gate 55, where we might find a SpiceJet official. Exhausted, we ascended the stairs to the second floor, only to be informed by the official that the incoming flight from Pune had not yet arrived, and we were asked to wait.

Our ordeal continued as we were shuttled from one distant gate to another. Breathless and weary, we finally tried to rest, only to be redirected yet again, this time to Gate 52. The sheer inefficiency and lack of coordination displayed by SpiceJet were appalling.

This incident is not an isolated one; delayed flights seem to be a chronic issue with SpiceJet, as we and our family members have experienced similar predicaments before. For instance, on August 18, 2024, my wife endured another harrowing experience with SpiceJet flight SG 8174 ( PNR: ZIYIXN)  from Kolkata (Terminal 2) to Delhi (Terminal 3). The flight, originally scheduled to depart at 17:40 and arrive at 20:05, was delayed to 22:00 and finally landed at 23:50. Such significant delays are unacceptable and indicative of systemic issues within the airline.

It appears that the airline is plagued by financial constraints, leading to a reduced fleet that is overburdened with frequent trips, resulting in persistent delays. These financial woes also manifest in the form of minimal service counters and inadequately trained staff, culminating in subpar service. Even the baggage claim process is affected, with shared counters causing further delays in luggage retrieval.

In light of these harrowing experiences, I strongly advise against travelling with SpiceJet. The airline's dismal service and operational inefficiencies make it a choice best avoided.

Dhananjay Sinha 
PNR FHY9KK
1661 ( wife ) /1662 ( self )
SG 8251 Dated 17-10-2024

title: Horrendous experience with 2 consecutive flight cancellations delaying our departure by 2 days
text:
Absolutely horrendous experience, it was a nightmare. We went all the way to airport, got luggage checked in and got the boarding passes. After all that they tell us the flight is delayed by more than an hour due to a "technical problem" and that they don't have permission to take off after 5:30, so the flight will be cancelled and we cannot go.

Reluctantly we rescheduled to the next day flight at the same time, and surprise surprise, they call us back a few hours before departure time and tell us flight is delayed today also and will not take off mostly. They are also trying to convince us to cancel our tickets so they can present it as though we are the ones who willingly cancelled.

The basic question is why schedule a flight for take off just 1 hour before the cutoff time for when you are allowed to take off at the airport ?

Will never travel in this airline again, the amount of problems they have caused for us and the time wasted I can never do justice to. There were a lot of people irate and angry at the airport, I hope a consumer suit is filed against them. Suggest people to think twice before booking spicejet, there is a chance of your plans being ruined completely.

title: Flights OK but Poor Management and Failure to Process Promised Refunds
text:
I have flown SpiceJet three times, but unfortunately will never fly with them again. The flights themselves (on somewhat aged aircraft) are always OK, but the airline has very serious managerial problems that will keep me away. First, the airline has a habit of arbitrarily cancelling or changing flights without consistently warning the passenger-- sometimes you know via email or WhatsApp, and sometimes you don't (unless you manually check on their website or app). 

The second problem is much more serious. After malfunctions with their website caused a duplicate booking and charge on my credit card 11 days ago, SpiceJet has made it virtually impossible for me to receive a refund-- I have spent hours on the phone and been promised its prompt processing multiple times. Soon I will be forced to file a formal dispute through my American credit card bank and Indian civil authorities. There is no excuse for this highly unethical behavior. They have lost a loyal customer.

title: Bad Customer Service Experience
text:
On October 5, 2024, my parents and family members were supposed to board the fight SG 869 (PNR: KG26VQ) from Kolkata to Port Blair. The flight was scheduled from 7:25 - 9:30 am. Boarding time was 6:55 am. 

They reached the airport late due to heavy traffic on the road. When they checked in at 7:15 am, they were told that the flight had already reached the runway and couldn‚Äôt be informed of their arrival. The flight departed without them, leading to wastage of their tickets. 

While I understand the delay from their side (which was caused by the harrowing traffic), airlines have the practice of getting in touch with customers if they are getting delayed. I am a frequent flyer and I have experienced multiple cases when either the ground staff has given me a call asking for my arrival status or even the flights waiting for a few minutes (5-10) to accommodate customers who have gotten delayed. 

In this case, not only were they not contacted before with flight left for the runway without them, the ground staff told them that they could not contact the flight in any way when they reached the airport at 7:15 am. I would like to reiterate here that the flight was scheduled to departure at 7:25 am, so even though they were late for boarding, they were at the airport near the boarding gate BEFORE the departure time. Yet the flight left without four of its customers, without any intimation from the ground staff. 

This is a high degree of unprofessionalism displayed by SpiceJet team. My parents or other family members could have been called and contacted before the flight left for the runway. The team should have made efforts to know their arrival status and been in touch with them. This is a standard practice among airline customer services which was completely avoided in this case. We are deeply disappointed.

title: Spicejet - An epitome of Fraudulent airlines

They said that the flight is delayed by more than 8 hrs so plz book another flight with another airlines and claim for a full refund with Spicejet and the refund shall be credited to your account within 5-7 working days. And today, after a month of follow ups and submission of all the necessary proofs to them, all I get to hear from the airlines is their senseless, crap response that I had boarded the flight back then and hence your refund request has been rejected. Utter crap. Unfortunately, my hard earned money is gone but if you don't want to waste yours, I request to go with any other airlines but not Spicejet. You will only and only regret it later.

It's my own personal, worst experience with the worst airlines in the world Spicejet.

title: Worst Worst Worst Worst!!!!!!
text:
A Nightmare with SpiceJet Airlines: A Warning to Fellow Travelers

On the night of August 31st, 2024, our journey with SpiceJet Airlines from Dubai to Delhi quickly turned into a nightmare. Our flight, originally scheduled to depart at 10:45 PM, was delayed multiple times without any clear communication. First, we were told it would take off at 1:45 AM on September 1st. As frustrating as that was, nothing could prepare us for the next delay: 7:30 AM.

However, the most distressing part of this experience was the lack of support from SpiceJet‚Äôs ground staff. Instead of offering genuine help, we were given absurd options like taking a different flight from Dubai to Pune, or worse, canceling our current flight and booking a new one with another airline at our own expense. This left us and other passengers feeling abandoned and helpless, with no alternative but to wait for hours on end.

To add insult to injury, SpiceJet informed us that any refund for our disrupted flight would take up to 30 days. The audacity of this airline is beyond comprehension, expecting us to wait an entire month to get back what is rightfully ours after such a horrendous experience.

It was also shocking to hear from fellow passengers that this isn‚Äôt an isolated incident. Apparently, this has been happening for quite some time. SpiceJet‚Äôs recurring delays, poor communication, and lack of customer support have become the norm. We were left feeling powerless, stranded in a foreign country with no real help or concern from the airline that we trusted with our travel plans.

This experience was not just a minor inconvenience‚Äîit was a complete disruption of our lives and plans. I urge anyone considering SpiceJet to think twice before booking. No one should have to go through what we did, and no airline should be allowed to treat its passengers with such blatant disregard. This is a plea to all travelers: be warned, and don‚Äôt let SpiceJet ruin your journey as they did ours.

This summary captures the frustration and disappointment with SpiceJet and serves as a warning for others. You can share this on social media, review platforms, or directly with the airline‚Äôs customer service team.

title: Worst Behavior, Poor Service Experience
text:
Feedback on Poor Service Experience - SpiceJet Flight SG-59 on 22nd August 2024
Dear 
SpiceJet Sr Management Team & Customer Service,

I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with the service I received from both your airport staff and call center team in relation to my flight SG-59 from Bombay to Dubai, scheduled for 2:00 AM on 22nd August 2024.

Details of the Experience:

I arrived at Terminal 2 of the airport at 10:15 PM on 21st August 2024.

Airport Experience:

Upon inquiring about SpiceJet‚Äôs office at Terminal 2, I was informed by the security that your customer service and booking office are located at Terminal 1. Upon reaching Terminal 1, I approached the help desk where two employees, a male and a female, were present. The female employee contacted the duty manager, Ms. More, who informed me that they couldn‚Äôt assist with postponing my flight and advised me to contact the call center instead.

Call Center Experience:

I called the call center at 11:40 PM and had to wait for an hour before my call was finally answered by Mr. Ansu, who informed me that he could not assist and that I needed to email higher management. Additionally, I received an SMS notifying me that my flight was delayed by 2 hours. I called the call center again at 12:15 AM, and after another half-hour wait, my call was answered by Ms. Kushi, who stated that any changes to my booking should have been made 4 hours prior.

Concerns:

1. Inadequate Customer Service:

The staff at the airport were not helpful in addressing my concerns or providing a solution. I expected better on-ground assistance from SpiceJet.

2. Call Center Delays:

 The extensive wait times on both calls were unacceptable, and the responses provided by your call center representatives were unhelpful and dismissive.

3. Lack of Clear Communication:

There was no clear guidance on how to handle my situation, and I was left without any viable options.

I am extremely disappointed with this experience, and I would appreciate it if you could look into this matter. It would be helpful to understand why there was such a lack of support from your team and what steps will be taken to prevent this from happening in the future.

I look forward to your prompt response.

Sincerely,  

Raj kumar Thakur

title: BEWARE STUDENTS
text:
Advisory for Students Traveling with SpiceJet:

I encountered an unpleasant experience with SpiceJet (SG8937, Pune to Delhi). Although I booked using my student ID, entitling me to a 25+7 kg baggage allowance, I faced difficulties. My check-in suitcase weighed 19.4 kg, and my hand baggage, containing study materials, weighed 10.3 kg - a mere 3.3 kg over the limit.

Regrettably, SpiceJet demonstrated minimal cooperation, unlike other airlines like Indigo. Despite my check-in baggage being 6 kg underweight, they demanded extra payment for the slight hand baggage excess. My courteous requests, highlighting my student status, were met with dismissiveness.

Students, be aware: SpiceJet exhibits limited flexibility and hospitality.

title: SpiceJet Flight SG 59 from Mumbai to Dubai Delayed, Passengers Frustrated Over Lack of Support
text:
Mumbai, August 14, 2024 ‚Äì Passengers on SpiceJet Flight SG 59, scheduled to depart from Mumbai‚Äôs Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport to Dubai International Airport, faced significant delays and mounting frustration this morning as the flight was unexpectedly rescheduled from 2:00 AM to 8:00 AM (6 Hours Delay).

The delay, which left passengers stranded at the airport, has been met with widespread dissatisfaction, particularly due to the unhelpful attitude of the airline staff and the absence of any compensation or amenities. Many travelers, including those with connecting flights in Dubai, expressed their anger and disappointment at the lack of support and information provided by SpiceJet.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been waiting here for hours with no clear communication from the airline,‚Äù said one passenger. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no help, no food, no accommodations‚Äînothing. It‚Äôs unacceptable.‚Äù

Another passenger, who had an interconnecting flight from Dubai, voiced concern over the lack of compensation. ‚ÄúAccording to the law, we should be entitled to a refund or some form of compensation for this mess. Instead, we‚Äôre left to fend for ourselves.‚Äù

The situation at the airport has grown increasingly tense as more passengers express their frustration over the poor service. Many are calling for immediate action and accountability from SpiceJet to address the inconvenience caused by the delay.

As of now, SpiceJet has not issued an official statement regarding the delay or the passengers‚Äô¬†concerns.

title: Horrendous Experience with SpiceJet Airlines
text:

title: Disappointing Experience with SpiceJet: Unreliable Service and Poor Customer Support
text:
I recently had a rather unpleasant experience with SpiceJet that I feel compelled to share. I booked a flight with SpiceJet through the Amazon app on August 10th for a departure time of 11:10 PM. However, shortly after making the booking, I received a notification informing me that my flight had been rescheduled to 12:45 AM. This change was inconvenient but manageable.

Upon arriving at the airport and checking in for my flight, I was shocked to receive yet another message stating that the flight had been further delayed to 2:45 AM. This sudden rescheduling caused significant disruption to my travel plans and inconvenienced me greatly.

Frustrated and disappointed by the lack of reliability in SpiceJet's scheduling, I approached the airline staff to request a refund. To my dismay, not only did I encounter uncooperative staff, but I was also appalled by their unprofessional behavior and their use of inappropriate language. The way I was treated by both the airline and their support team was entirely unacceptable.

As a customer who values punctuality, reliability, and respectful customer service, my experience with SpiceJet fell far short of my expectations. The repeated rescheduling of my flight, coupled with the disrespectful behavior of the airline's staff, has left me deeply dissatisfied with my overall experience.

I urge SpiceJet to take customer feedback seriously, address issues of flight scheduling reliability, and ensure that their staff maintain a professional and respectful demeanor when interacting with customers. Until such improvements are made, I regret to say that I cannot recommend SpiceJet as a reliable or customer-friendly airline choice.

I hope my feedback serves as a constructive criticism for SpiceJet to enhance their services and customer relations in the future.

title: Exceptional Piloting in most Extreme turbulence & reverse Weather
text:
I was coming back to Delhi on 31st July from SHIRDI on Spicejet flight no. SG 8946 expected to Land at 7.30 PM.
Since the weather was extremely bad during the whole flight, there were frequent turbulences.
On the Last stretch for around 45 minutes we were asked to put Seatbelts on due to constant Turbulence & all passengers were frightened.
But the Pilot & the crew kept very Calm & Composed and Pilot also sounded very confident assuring us with his regular announcements although being a frequent flyer I knew this was very unusual weather disturbance & later came to know that many flights were diverted from Delhi that time as there was constant heavy downpour but our brave Pilot landed the flight very smoothly 
and with minimum delay for which I have suggested to Spicejet that 
with this exceptional handling of the Adverse situation, their Pilot has surely set an example for other Pilots which must be commended & rewarded also.

title: Worst airlines ever!
text:
My experience with SpiceJet was appalling. Our flight was delayed four times, forcing us to stay an extra day. We were traveling with children from the US and had just stopped in Dubai before heading to a family event in Madurai. At the time, SpiceJet was the only airline offering flights from Dubai to Madurai, so we had no choice but to fly with them.

When we finally arrived at the airport after our additional day in Dubai, the service was dismal. The counter staff were unprofessional and indifferent to the long line of frustrated passengers. They seemed more interested in chatting, laughing, and eating snacks behind the counter than assisting travelers. When I started recording the chaos, one of the staff members jumped over the counter and threatened to report me to airport security. It was absurd that filming their lack of service was met with such hostility.

SpiceJet's staff, from the counter to the flight attendants, displayed a shocking lack of customer care. The whole experience felt like a chaotic and poorly managed affair. I would strongly advise against flying with SpiceJet and would certainly avoid this airline in the future.

title: Never again! Very much disappointed
text:
29th July, boarding was completed by 11 pm and all passengers were onboard in the aircraft to depart at 11:30. After 2 hrs of long and suffocating waiting they announced that due to technical issues, the flight will not be taking off, so all passengers were requested to get down and be back to the gate. title: DO NOT MAKE THE MISTAKE OF FLYING WITH SPICEJET
text:
If Tripadvisor had negative ratings, I would've selected that. Spicejet used to be a good low cost airlines but off late they have become absolute scammers. There flights get delayed a lot and to prevent themselves from compensating the customers, they delay the flights by 1 hour at a time. Eg: If your flight is going to be delayed by 4 hours, then they are going to send you 4 different messages one by one mentioning the flight getting delayed by 1 hour. When you talk to their ground attendants regarding DGCA rules for refreshments and meals due to the delay, they simply say that we had sent out messages and already informed you for a delay of 1 hour which is the worst system loophole that they could've used to prevent themselves from providing the customers with the well deserved compensation. To add the final nail in the coffin, their staff is not apologetic at all, in fact they are extremely rude.
My flight got delayed by 4.5 hours in the above manner and there was literally no compensation provided even though it was a late night flight.
Bottom line is... Customer service is something that Spicejet does not believe in anymore. They are just trying to squeeze out money from their customers to stop themselves from ending up as Go First but if this misuse of customer's trust continues, there's only one inevitable fate for such airlines.

title: Complaint regarding appalling behavior & experience of spicejet staff & delayed flight!
text:
Dear SpiceJet Customer Service,

I am writing to express my extreme dissatisfaction with the appalling behavior of your staff at the Dubai airport and the overall poor service on my recent flight from Dubai to Ahmedabad on the 15th of July. The experience was nothing short of a nightmare, and I am deeply angered by the unprofessionalism and rudeness displayed by your employees.

We had a minor issue of 2kg excess baggage ‚Äì 1kg in each of our hand luggage bags. Despite this, your staff insisted on us paying extra. We agreed to comply with the rules and pay the fee, but the manner in which we were treated was absolutely unacceptable. The staff spoke to us in a highly unpleasant and unprofessional tone, completely lacking the basic courtesy of a smile or any form of politeness.

The behavior of your ground staff was so egregious that it has left a lasting negative impression on us. Such ridiculous treatment from airline staff is unheard of and has convinced us never to board SpiceJet again. I will be sharing this horrible experience with my friends and family, urging them to avoid your services as well.

The in-flight experience was no better. The cabin crew was equally rude, and despite asking for water twice, I had to wait for 20 minutes before it was finally served. This lack of basic customer service is simply outrageous.

Additionally, after taking 1kg out of one bag, your staff still demanded payment, continuing their rude demeanor. This entire experience was incredibly frustrating and disappointing.

To add to the misery, the flight, scheduled to take off at 7:20 PM, was initially delayed to 8:00 PM but eventually took off at 9:30 PM, causing further inconvenience and frustration.

Moreover, I was forced to discard some of my personal belongings, including food, in a disgusting manner right outside the entrance. This added to the already horrendous experience. I am attaching an image of the discarded items below.

I demand an explanation for this unacceptable behavior and a formal apology from your team. Such treatment of passengers is disgraceful and should not be tolerated. Having such staff just removes value from your company, showcasing a horrible attitude. 

I was really upset at the time, but now that I think back, I regret not taking the names of the rude staff!!!!!

I look forward to your prompt response and hope that serious measures will be taken to ensure that no other passenger has to endure such a dreadful experience in the future.

title: Worst airlines....Bad Review for SpiceJet Management.
text:
**Bad Review for SpiceJet Management:**

I had an incredibly frustrating experience with SpiceJet regarding a simple just small 3 letters name mismatch issue between my passport and ticket. Despite providing my passport, Emirates ID, and debit card details which is used for this ticket booking, SpiceJet failed to resolve the issue. Their management was shockingly unhelpful and displayed a complete lack of empathy towards customer concerns.

When I visited the SpiceJet office, hoping for a solution, the management's response was cold and dismissive. They outright refused to make any effort to correct the name on my ticket, claiming it was against their policy. It's astonishing that with all the information I provided, they couldn't facilitate a straightforward name modification in their system.

Yesterday, they prevented me from traveling, causing a waste of my time , energy and money.

Their proposed solution was absurd and customer-unfriendly. They insisted that I should forfeit the entire ticket amount and rebook if I wanted to travel. This shows a blatant disregard for customer satisfaction and a complete absence of flexibility in their policies.

Overall, my experience with SpiceJet's management was beyond disappointing. They not only failed to address a basic customer service issue but also displayed a lack of professionalism and willingness to assist. I would strongly advise against using SpiceJet if you value competent and customer-centric service.

SpiceJet Limited  
Dubai Airports 

#DubaiAirport #SpiceJet #CustomerServiceFail

title: Spicejet is the worst airline on the earth
text:
I have travelled more than 100 time on airlines and based on my experience Spicejet is the worst airline on earth. 
I recently traveled with SpiceJet on SG 529, from Bengaluru to Delhi on 26 Jun 2024. I did not have any checked-in luggage and was carrying only one carry-on bag, which weighed 9 kg. I was aware of the carry-on baggage policy and was prepared to comply with it. However, the manner in which your boarding staff handled the situation was completely unacceptable. The staff member was extremely rude and arrogant, refusing to allow me to board the flight asked me to pay extra money so I asked them to put my luggage in check-in so that it fits in the luggage policy of (15kg checkin & 7 kg hand baggage) but they denied that also. Another passenger with no luggage offered to help me adjust the weight by sharing some of my items, but the staff at the boarding counter refused to allow this reasonable solution
Despite my attempts to reason with the staff and explain my situation, I was forced to leave several personal items at the airport, which was both distressing and inconvenient. The entire experience was unpleasant and left me feeling humiliated. Such inflexibility only added to my frustration and disappointment with SpiceJet's service.

Additionally, I would like to bring to attention to an earlier bad experience with SpiceJet. In December 2022, my family and I (a total of four members) traveled from Gwalior to Mumbai. During this trip, we had 15,000 rupees stolen from our checked-in luggage. I filed a complaint regarding this theft on spicejet customer care no. but to date, no resolution has been provided by SpiceJet.

title: One of the most pathetic service from.spice jet
text: One of the poorest services and staff attitude is out of the world having checked in 2 bags at the same time from dubai staff said one was checked in late and didn't arrive and one did !!! Did not make sense,when questioned them and spoke to duty manager at that time on 24th June night mr vinay...his statement was I don't care....really!!!!! Later hia collegue calls me to infirm that the 3rd party was given my bg to be delivered the next day but they delayed to deliver and he does not know when it will be delivered !!!!!!What non complainant and baddd service been 38 hours now still await bag......way to goooo spicejet

title: Racism & Rude Behavior of SpiceJet Crew
text:
PNR Number TBM9XC

My husband and I recently traveled from Delhi to Bangkok by Spicejet SG87 on 14th June 2024 departure at 2140hrs, seat # 31G&H. To begin with, the flight was delayed, we boarded at 9.15 and it was mentioned in the lounge that the gate had closed. We ran like hell from the lounge, left our food and coffee to witness that the boarding gate had a long queue to board the bus first to enter the aircraft which took another 25 mins, and finally approx. 9.15 pm we were in the aircraft. While sitting and waiting for half an hour to fly, we realized the flight was delayed as it finally flew at 10.30. Meanwhile, there were kids, elderly people, and the younger generation who wanted to know the status or asked for water from the crew, they were yelled at. The crew was 95% non-Indian, including 03 women and 2 males (what I remember) and for the first time, I realised what racism is. One of the honeymoon couples asked for water, and a male crew came and yelled at the husband that if you kept ringing the bell, we wouldn‚Äôt prepare the food trolley and I was right behind that couple. I could see the embarrassment he faced in front of his newly married-wife. One of the families who had 5 college-going travelers with them, changed their seat with a fellow passenger with mutual understanding. One of the female crew came and started yelling at the mother saying with what permission have you changed the seats? Did you put in a request to us before changing it the passenger explained that we had requested the fellow passenger, and they did not have any issues though she rudely spoke to the father (60+) whose birthday trip it was. I was furious at them and wanted to record their behaviors; the entire flight was talking about their behaviors and were not comfortable asking anything from them. One of the boys' groups of 5 had different seats and 2 sat on their respective seats which were different from each other and remaining 3 asked the crew if they could get a seat together however they did not know English what I noticed was again making fun of them and showing rudeness.

From a delayed flight, the least expectation one has is politeness and consideration from the crew. Offering water is basic though instead of asking, passengers were yelled at. I have taken a few pictures of seats which were all dirty, broken, etc. It was the first and the last trip with SpiceJet. I expect an apology from Spicejet for the racism I saw towards Indian passengers and rudeness. #boycottspicejet #spicejetapologies #dontravelwithspicejet

 
Note ‚Äì We came back 19th morning with Air India and boy, what a flight and journey. Smooth boarding, crew, food, experience etc

title: Horrible Experience
text:
I am writing to express my deep dissatisfaction with the service provided by SpiceJet on 19th June 2024. I had originally booked flight SG8386 from Srinagar to Mumbai. Shockingly, the flight was cancelled just 8 hours before departure, leaving me with very little time to make alternative arrangements.
 
Despite the inconvenience, I rebooked a flight for the same day, which was crucial as I had a connecting flight from Mumbai to Dubai. Unfortunately, upon rebooking with SpiceJet from Srinagar to Delhi, the flight was delayed by 1 hour and 15 minutes. This delay caused me to miss my connecting flight from Delhi to Mumbai, further complicating my travel plans.
 
Throughout this ordeal, I experienced horrible customer service. The representatives I interacted with were extremely unprofessional and displayed a lack of empathy and understanding. The entire situation was handled poorly, with no consideration for the significant inconvenience caused to me.
 
As a result of these disruptions, I had to spend twice the amount initially planned due to last-minute bookings and missed connections. The financial burden and stress caused by this experience were unacceptable.
 
I urge SpiceJet to take immediate action to improve their customer service standards and ensure such incidents do not happen in the future. This experience has severely tarnished my perception of SpiceJet, and I hope they take necessary steps to rectify their shortcomings.
 
I hope this revised review accurately reflects your experience and effectively communicates your grievances.

title: NEVER EVER SPICEJET
text:
Hi Fellas. Never ever in your life travel by Spicejet Airlines. One of the worst, poorest and pathetic airlines that‚Äôs out there.
Sorry to say, but their only intention of running the airlines service is to make money as much as possible at the expense of their passengers.
On June 17 2024, I had a flight from Delhi to Bagdogra. They denied to give me my boarding pass because I was 10mins late to check in. Ms. Tannu was the one who adamantly denied to give me the boarding pass (I have had experience of arriving late for my past flights too but no one had ever denied me the boarding pass).
 I pleaded several times but no cooperation was shown. Funny thing, after I had ended my continuous appeal and given up. I still had 35mins in my hand.
Thanks Spicejet for giving me this wonderful experience that I will remember my whole life. Now I know never ever to travel by your airlines.
Stay away from it  folks, if you want to be out of trouble.

title: Do not fly with Spice Jet
text:
This is the worst airline ever. I booked 2 tickets online. Did not receive any confirmation whatsoever. After waiting a week abd noticing payment has been taken I called their customer services to find out what they delay was. They said they has no record of my booking or me in general yet they charged me for the flight. 
They asked me to email customer services for a refund. To date I have not received a single penny even after stating that they will reimburse me.
When I got back to England I rang my credit company and explained the problem.  They refunded me whilst they investigated but later took back the money as they agreed with spice jet that I had not followed their terms and conditions that I ticked when booking .
What a joke! Normally when you pay for something you get a booking reference number so you can pursue your goods or service. 
Luckily I didn't book twice instead I booked with Air India who were delightful and got us to Mumbai on time for our flight back to London.
I hope this company get what they deserve for cheating customers and ripping people off. 
I advice all to boycott this airline .

title: Cheated out of my refund
text: My flight at 6pm was canceled and I was moved to another one 10 hours earlier at 8 am. It was not possible for me to catch that flight. Their website promised to refund the money in full to the same credit card I used to pay. When I asked for it I was told they would only refund it to a Indian bank account. As a non Indian I do not have that. I never got my refund.

We had a terrible Experience flying with Spice jet also no support or guidance is given by any of the staff. This was our last flight by Spice jet. Requesting people to think twice about the security of your luggage before travelling through spice jet.

title: The worst experience of my life!
text:
My to an fro flight from Delhi to Srinagar and return were both delayed. In fact my flight from Delhi was cancelled and rescheduled without any information. Luckily I had enquired 5 hours before the flight and found this to my shock. The return from Srinagar has been one of my worst flight experiences ever and prompted me to write a review. The ground staff let me pass through with my back pack since I had nothing to check in. I was carrying things that would break. The boarding was delayed by 45mins and I saw the previous flight passengers also having a tussle with at the gate before boarding. At the gate I gave my boarding pass but they stopped me and every other passenger to check the weight of the backpack. It was two kgs up but i pleaded that i had no check in and these items will break. They asked us all to pay a fine or they won't let
us board. They refused to listen to me or any other passenger. They even locked the gate and announced that boarding it complete. This was absolute nonsense and bullying. On top of that they wanted to take the luggage for check in and refused to put a fragile tag. Clearly this is your way of making money and you have fallen to such a low level. To add insult to Injury I reached 4 hours late and had to cancel all my further plans. I would rather pay more but am never spice jetting again!

title: Horrible experience with SpiceJet
text:
Horrible experience. I booked the flight for 8am from Delhi. A day before I was informed that my flight is rescheduled for 9.45am. I checked the internet it showed the 8am flight is scheduled on time and there is another flight of SG at 9.45am with same flight number. I called the airlines and they were very stern and as the reschedule was within 3 hours, it is not refundable. So without any other option left, I did the web check in. Airlines send me the boarding pass 3 hours later which mentions my flight timing as 10.45am without any intimation for re re schedule. Again I checked internet which was showing that 8am and 9.45am flights are still scheduled at their own time.
There is big fraud going on with this airline where I suppose they keep on taking the bookings till the end and charge very high. Travellers who have booked earlier with low fares are pushed to later flights flying at low demand timing. It is 6.45am and I am still not sure whether I will fly at 10.45am or some more foul play is awaited.

title: Feedback on Recent Flight Experience -Below average
text:
I recently traveled with spicejet from Dubai to Calicut on 15/05/2024. I would like to provide feedback on my experience, particularly concerning the seating arrangements, additional charges for extra weight, and the conduct of the staff.

Firstly, I found the seating on the flight to be excessively congested. The limited legroom and narrow seats made the journey uncomfortable and less than ideal, especially for a longer flight. This lack of space significantly impacted my ability to relax and enjoy the flight.

Additionally, I was taken aback by the strictness regarding extra weight charges. While I understand the importance of adhering to weight regulations for safety reasons, the fees imposed seemed quite high and were applied with little flexibility or understanding. This added unexpected stress and financial burden to my travel experience.

Furthermore, the demeanor of some staff members was less than satisfactory. I found their approach to enforcing rules to be overly rigid and lacking in empathy. A more customer-friendly and understanding attitude would greatly enhance the overall travel experience.

I hope you will consider this feedback and make necessary improvements to ensure a more comfortable and pleasant journey for your passengers in the future.

title: SpiceJet - a shameless looter that looks for ways to harrass customers
text:
I unfortunately flew on SG8478 on 6th May from Patna to Delhi and completely shocked to see how SpiceJet is looting it's customers through it's  croocked modus operandi. I had just one bag which I thought was around 10kgs and a laptop bag. As I had web checked so I directly dashed to the gate and waited. For the 9.45pm flight, they started boarding at around 9.15pm, and while checking my boarding pass the staff asked another person by the name of Kanish Kumar, who was already weighing some bags of other customers to weigh my bag. As general practice, sometimes the airlines do ask people to put their bags in luggage than cabin if it's more than 7-8 Kgs, so calmly moved aside and told the other staff I had only one bag and no luggage. He did not respond anything but just continued to weigh my bag and said it's 11 Kgs and then asked me to give my laptop bag for weighing, so I was baffled...I said its a small laptop bag why do you need to wiegh that but he said he has to check the total weight. He weighed it and said 4 kgs so total of 15kgs and I have to pay Rs 3000. I said I have only one bag and even including laptop bag it's well within 15kgs of allowed limit. I Said you put my bag in laggage if you want. So, he responded "thats not my work". I said no problem, I can myself go and give as there's still time. He said no baggage loading counter is now closed and if I wanted to board then I have to pay. Just at this another staff by the name of Shaheela Parveen, quickly pounded on me and said I was too much time. This lady was immensely badly behaved and I told her that I will file a formal complaint for your behaviour and this act of cheating customers. She was least bothered and said fine now you have to payRs 4800 ans earlier we were giving you Rs1800 discount. I asked her charge me in full if she is is sure that this is how they operate. Working for bad company is alright but it was sad to see someone with such a bad upbringing as well, it seems SpiceJets selects such people as they need rowdies than hospitality staffs!

It was clear to me that this is by design and Spice jet wants these staff to fleece the passengers! Spice Jet you are True disgrace to the Indian hospitality sector and a shame to the Indian aviation industry.

Really think hard before falling for their cheap tickets, they will make you repent later. I have flown 4-5 times in Spice Jet, an this was the final one almost every time I have experienced change in schedule/ delayed flight, horrific landing as if they dump the flight on runways on landing, badly behaved flight staff and crew....so on and so forth.I would rather take a bus ride than risking it with Spice Jet ever again.

To Spice Jet I would only say - I know you guys are struggling but do some soul searching if there is any shame left. You are looting people  broad day light and risking lives. If you think a business can be saved by stealing by cheating customers then you are wrong g my friend!  Better close your shop with whatever grace is left!

title: PLEASE READ: Do not trust spicejet. Do not ignore the reviews.
text:
Everyone knows the reputation spicejet has. I chose to ignore it and had booked a round trip with spicejet Hyderabad - Chennai.

On my flight to Chennai, I had a terrible experience.

The flight was already delayed by an hour. I did not have a checkin bag, and only had cabin. I was asked to pay 1800rs extra for my laptop bag. I've never faced this with any other airline. They waited for the flight checkin to close to start checking the bags. I was forced to pay the full amount, but they gave a discount for the passenger who came after me. Not fair.

During the takeoff, the engine (and in turn the AC) was turned on in the last moment to save fuel. Even after landing, as we were waiting for 10 minutes to find a place to deboard, the engine was turned off to save fuel.

The flying experience was also not good, a bathroom door that kept making noise in the air - it was loose I guess. 

It's really surprising that spicejet is still operating.

Coming to my return flight (at 8:45am), I was hoping it would be smooth. But again, just at the time of checking in my baggage (7:35am), I get message that the flight has been rescheduled to 12noon. 

Upon checking with the staff they said the flight was supposed to come from Ahmedabad to Chennai, before going to Hyderabad, but due to technical reasons got sent back mid way. Even the 12noon was just an estimate and it can get delayed further.

There was no other airline having a flight earlier than that too. And obviously now with higher prices since it's last minute. But anyways I took this as a punishment for booking Spicejet. Took a full refund (which is pennies compared to the fare of my new booking and the cab from and to the airport again) and booked with a different airline.

I chose to ignore the other reviews, I hope you don't. Spicejet was bad, is bad and will be bad. I don't see how one can trust their life on Spicejet when they're this unreliable.

title: Exceptional Service by Ms. Akansha Parashar
text: During security check, I forgot my valuable laptop at the Delhi airport. After reaching home in Pune, I called up Ms. Akansha Parashar working at the desk of SpiceJet who was very kind and she sprang into action. Within 45 mnts, she located my laptop & guided me through the process of retrieving the same. Ms. Akansha Parashar went beyond her duties to assist me for which she deserves much of the appreciation. Akansha saved me a lot of trouble, millions of thanks to Ms. Akansha Parashar, SpiceJet. SH.he is indeed an asset for SPiceJet.

title: Our fragile jars in the cabin baggage were broken

title: SpiceJet cancelled flights for my family and refused to refund us! We were left out of pocket. BEWARE!!
text:
TLDR: They cancelled our flight - refused to refund us. SpiceJet cancelled our flights (2 pax) and rescheduled us to the following day. Since the flight was for an event, it we couldn't reschedule for later, so we called SpiceJet customer service and they said they'd issue a refund. I asked for a confirmation number for the refund, or some evidence that it would be refunded, but the rep said that all calls were recorded and that he would not provide any evidence, the recorded call was enough. 
The refund never came. 
I spent a total 3 hours on hold/calls and half a dozen emails over 2 months, at each step of the way they started from zero, threw up barriers, asking for information they had on file - it didn't feel like an genuine attempt to gather data, rather it seemed like a way find obscure information that might be hard to produce to frustrate people into giving up. After I set a deadline of 3 months for the promised refund and expressed my impatience, they responded by saying that they couldn't help me further and declined to refund me.  BEWARE! If they cancel your flight - you might not be refunded a cent.

title: Disappointed
text:
Dear SpiceJet,

I want to express my disappointment regarding my recent flight experience from Dubai to Delhi on 6th April 2024. As a frequent traveler, I was shocked by the lack of communication and transparency regarding luggage fees. It was extremely frustrating to be charged an additional 210 AED at the boarding counter for exceeding the 3 kg weight limit including duty free in my cabin bag especially when I was not informed about it earlier when dropping off my check-in 1 pcs of bag only 20kg. The presence of a weight machine and cash collection book beside the boarding gate was not only surprising but also highly inconvenient. This experience has left a negative impression, and I hope that you will take steps to improve communication and customer service in the future.
Mohammed Raza Ahmad
razaalhoda@gmail.com

title: BAD AND PATHETIC EXPERIENCE WITH SPICEJET
text:
A real awful experience with Spicejet airlines  ! 
First of all, the flight was delayed 5 times  ! 
As for a result, we take off after 10.30pm from Guwahati with an initial departure at 4.35pm. The last messages of these "inconveniences" as they call it were sent on the same day. The only alternative they proposed was to change flight but with no option on the same day. 
Another issue with this company, comparing with others in the domestic India sector, is the lack of kindness, of professional behaviour of the ground staff. From the luggages screening to the check in, they act like frustrated and even arrogant people towards their customers. 
The one who did my check in was particularly a caricature of a detestable person. 
About their Boeing flights, they are old with uncomfortable seats with a narrow place between them. 
To make short, I don't recommend this Spicejet company to anyone. 
Better other options are giving much more satisfaction to fly all around India  !

title: hand bang missing inside the flight
text:
I recently flew with SpiceJet SG-54 on 1st April 2024 from DXB to CCJ and unfortunately encountered an issue with missing luggage. Despite reporting the issue immediately upon arrival, I was disappointed with the lack of action taken by the airline to address the situation.

Upon landing, I promptly notified SpiceJet staff about the missing luggage, providing all necessary details. However, I was dismayed by the lack of communication and follow-up from the airline regarding the status of my luggage.

As a customer, I understand that unforeseen circumstances can occur, but it's essential for airlines to prioritize customer service and take proactive steps to resolve such issues. Unfortunately, my experience with SpiceJet fell short in this regard.

I urge SpiceJet to improve its baggage handling procedures and enhance communication with passengers regarding luggage issues. It's crucial for airlines to demonstrate accountability and provide timely updates to affected customers.

I hope that by sharing my experience, SpiceJet will take necessary steps to address the underlying issues and prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future.

title: WORST OF ALL TIME AND WORST EVER POSSIBLE
text:
To everyone reading this review,
Before sharing my experience I'd very strongly recommend everyone to never choose this as your flying partner. This is the WORST airlines company I've ever come across in my lifetime. SPICEJET AIRWAYS and DELAY are two words with same meaning. The reason I say this is stated below :

Departing from Shirdi, being Bengaluru as the destination, this ridiculous airline company delayed its flight by 3 hours first.
It was initially scheduled at 9:40 a.m and then rescheduled to 12:30 p.m
Everyone around was already frustrated from this incident and then the upcoming announcement literally flared up everyone from within.
This piece of crap airlines delayed the take off time of aircraft by 45 minutes again.
Everyone around was so frustrated that a group of men and women literally quarrelled with the company's attendant. The passengers consisted of aged as well as young kids and no compensation was made for thier inconvenience. Hungry and tired, longing to reach Bengaluru, the passengers were yelling aloud and it was an absolute mess at the airport. This airlines is the best airlines IF YOU WANT TO GET IRRITATED AND ANGRY AND HUNGRY.
"NO ONE SHOULD CHOOSE SPICEJET AIRLINES" was the cry at the airport.
The airline staff was NOT GOOD TOWARDS THE PASSENGERS.
The attitude and absolute lack of regret shown by the airline staff caught everyone's anger and became another reason for everyone's hatred towards SPICEJET AIRLINES.
This is definitely not the first time SPICEJET AIRLINES has let people down, because this AIRWAY COMPANY is very famous for causing inconvenience to the passengers.
It really seems like the goal of SPICEJET AIRWAYS IS TO CAUSE MOST INCONVENIENCE TO PEOPLE CHOOSING IT.
It would rather be a HAPPY MOMENT if this piece of crap in the name of airways SHUTS DOWN FOR GOOD.

All the incidents mentioned above have been occured at 12:24 p.m on 30/03/2024
