title: Worst
text:
https://youtube.com/shorts/asgGPpcUuxs?si=6B369VzeE-nlpR6C

If you're seeking a nightmare in the skies, look no further than SpiceJet ‚Äì the epitome of incompetence and indifference. My recent experience on flight SG 612 from Chennai to Mumbai was a harrowing journey into the abyss of despair, leaving me and countless others stranded without an ounce of compassion or support.

The saga began with a delay that stretched into eternity, as we, the hapless passengers, were kept waiting until the clock struck 11:30, only to be met with the devastating news of cancellation. But that was just the beginning of our ordeal. Instead of offering solace or assistance, SpiceJet's ground staff callously brushed aside our concerns with a chilling declaration of apathy: "We don't care, we can't help."

As a traveler with a 4-year-old and 4-month-old baby in tow, the callousness exhibited by SpiceJet staff is unforgivable. With no provisions for accommodation, transportation, or even basic empathy, we were left stranded at the mercy of circumstance, with no regard for the well-being of vulnerable passengers.

But perhaps what is most egregious is SpiceJet's blatant disregard for the dignity of its patrons. Amidst the chaos and confusion, their mantra of indifference echoed like a cruel joke, a stark reminder of their utter lack of respect for humanity.

I implore anyone considering air travel to heed this warning: steer clear of SpiceJet. Spare yourself the agony, frustration, and humiliation that come hand in hand with their abysmal service. Choose any other carrier, for in the skies of aviation, SpiceJet is a dark cloud that looms ominously over the horizon, casting a shadow of disdain upon all who dare to fly with them.

As promised, I have uploaded a video documenting this ordeal on YouTube, a testament to the inhumanity of SpiceJet and a plea for justice in the realm of air travel. Let it serve as a cautionary tale for those who value their dignity and deserve better than the deplorable treatment meted out by spicejet

text:
I am the HR of the company I HAVE BOOKED THE FLIGHT TICKET ONLINE VIA MAKE MY TRIP with SPICE JET Airline PNR: FINR4E and do the payment online successfully and received the ticket details and invoice 1,322 aed , suddenly the passenger called me told me they didn't allow him to travel from India because of OTB. I have contacted make my trip and told me it‚Äôs the airline responsibility to send me the OTB and I have never received any message or email from the airline regarding this OTB requirement to let the passenger travel neither from make my trip. i do many bookings online with make my trip and i have never faced such issue before. we need to refund our money as this is your responsibility to provide the full details before you take the money of the people, this is not a free of charge. and before we do any booking of the flight, we make sure that the person coming to Dubai with new employment visa has already get approval from his immigration in India.

I am requesting a refund of the ticket to the same credit card we did the payment with.
AND NOW spice jet is claiming it is the fault of the agency make my trip and make my trip is claiming that it is the fault of the airline spice jet to whom we made the payment. what a shame they are stealing the money of the people and non professional agency and airline to work with. and their stuff and supervisor are impolite and unhelpful.

title: VERY BAD TRAVELING EXPERIENCE WITH MY BABY
text:
I had a very unpleasant experience on my Spice Jet flight from Kozhikode to Dubai on 11/03/2024. I traveled with my 8-month-old baby. I had 30kg, 7kg, and 7kg of luggages, as well as a stroller and handbag. I requested the staff to put my both 7kg bags in luggage as I was alone travelling with my baby and i need to carry stroller and hand bag with me but they are refused to take my bags. Considering mothers and babies is important; I asked for 10 minutes, but they were not helpful. Afterward, the staff asked why I brought two bags when I was traveling with a baby*. SERIOUSLY !!! IS THIS SORT OF BEHAVIOR YOU EXHIBIT TOWARDS YOUR CUSTOMERS?? THEN WHY DID YOU MENTION BAGGAGE IN YOUR FLIGHT STATUS!!*! In the end, I had to carry two bags that were 7kg, a stroller, and a small handbag (baby food and diapers) with me. This is not my first flight with baby, in all other flights they had put my cabin bag in luggage as they give importantance to mothers and babies but Spice jet Very very bitter experience. Also the front seat was broken and it was in sliding position, we had a very little space in front of us and I don‚Äôt know how I sit there with my baby. I requested the crew to change my seat and they informed me that once the flight begins, they will inform me of any available seats. But I didn‚Äôt get any window seat as it was my special request while boarding since I had to feed my baby.

*This is my humble request to all mothers who is planning to travel with their babies, don't choose spice jet flight your journey will be spoiled.*

title: SPICEJET is a biggest SCAM, DO NOT book it
text:
SpiceJet proved to be incredibly disappointing and untrustworthy in my recent experience. Traveling with my family, a total of six individuals, we embarked on a journey from Amritsar (ATQ), India to DXB (Dubai) on February 24, 2024. The scheduled departure time was 08:40 AM, with a connecting flight from Dubai to London Heathrow at 14:30 Hrs via Emirates. Our ticket was booked through the booking.com portal as a single ticket, rather than separate bookings to facilitate the connection.

However, our experience with SpiceJet quickly turned sour. Departing from ATQ, the flight was delayed by 55 minutes. Upon arrival in Dubai, we encountered further frustration as we remained onboard the aircraft for over an hour and a half without disembarkation. Initially, we were given excuses regarding weather conditions, despite the clear and sunny day in Dubai, and the optimal weather conditions for takeoff. Eventually, a member of the ground staff revealed the truth - the delay was due to SpiceJet's scheduling issues and the busy nature of Dubai Airport.

This delay resulted in us missing our connecting flight to London Heathrow. Expecting assistance from SpiceJet, we hurried to their counter hoping for a resolution. However, to our dismay, they refused to take responsibility or provide any alternative solutions. Their staff was unhelpful and dismissive, leaving us stranded in Dubai with our children. Consequently, we were forced to purchase new tickets at a staggering cost of ¬£4061 to secure our journey back to the UK.

I feel compelled to caution others against falling victim to this airline's deceptive practices. SpiceJet's lack of accountability and disregard for customer welfare make them a company to avoid at all costs. 

Prabhdeep Singh

text:

The seats in the so-called SpiceMax area are the same size as all the other seats but do not recline. So we paid for an upgrade but ended up in the worst seats on the plane.

title: Please don't fly SpiceJet

title: Worst customer service, zero visibility at airport. No direct baggage transfer, International flight checkin opens at 7.
text:
Usually connecting flights take your baggage and give it you at your final destination if its the same carrier, but spice jet representative gave an excuse of immigration issues as I was connecting to an International flight flying from bhavnagar via Mumbai to Dubai. 

Not a reasonable explanation to do so, on the ticket it showed a layover of 8 hours so I thought fine. I will check in and rest at the terminal access lounge and other services at the Airport. But i was disappointed to know after collecting baggage from domestic terminal, heading to International that checkin counters will open just 3 hours before with no spicejet rep on site. 

I understand the convenience of saving money on rent and also manpower by doing so but the management of spicejet should atleast wonder why customers are opting for other carriers rather than choosing their company. Travellers love better customer service and visibility. 

Customers are happy to pay more if the service is right,  you don't need to pull money out of their pockets by creating hand luggage policies which only favor you.

Atleast ensure your staff is visible at airport and has reasonable explanation for their actions. There were also a lot of safety concerns in your flight too. 

Better become vigilant before someone complaints to civil aviation regarding the above.

title: Completely disappointed
text:
My mother and I chose Spicejet to travel from Goa to Mumbai in February 2024. We have always had issues in regards to flight delays with Spicejet in the past, but we decided to give it a go one last time, plus their flight schedule was the best personal choice for us for that particular day. I am sad to write that we experienced an even worser experience with Spicejet this time around than we usually do, in regards to time organization. I usually do not write reviews for airlines, but this time I feel it necessary. To cut a long story short, upon rushing us to go to the boarding gate before the actual boarding time commensed, we stood in line for about 25 minutes like sheep waiting to be loaded on the airplane. So we were hence late in our departure (as usual). However, to make it even worse, once we landed in Mumbai, they stuffed us in a bus to the extent that the doors could not close. It then took a few minutes for them to fix this technical bus issue. Following this, they transported us to Terminal 1 to collect our luggage. Yet, low and behold, the luggage belt was not coming on for a good 20 minutes, with all passengers standing around the belt looking confused. One Spicejet ground hostess was passing by so customers were asking her what is going on. She informed us that because the flight arrived at Terminal 2 the luggage may take a while till it arrives at our location (i.e. terminal 1). Now, the issue is not only delay in time, but also the lack of communication and extreme mismanagement of time and customer service. The least we would expect is the flight hostess or captain informing us prior to us disembarking that there will be a time delay in collecting our luggage (particularly with respect to passengers who are catching another domestic or international flight). 

All in all, I say this to Spicejet directly: you make your flying customers come to the airport and present themselves on time, and respect their airlines' departure schedule, yet you fail to respect our own time by making us wait approximately 30 minutes for our luggage, and without even informing us or providing a shred of communication in regards to the same. It's outrageous.
I think I speak on behalf of everyone on the flight when I say that we are all very disappointed with the service of Spicejet. 
To that I say, 'Spice it up' Spicejet, in terms of your customer service, respect, and decency...For your own good!

title: Worst Experience
text:
Goa Mopa to Bangalore.

The original departure time was 6 55 pm from Goa Mopa airport reaching Bangalore at 8 15 pm. I then get a message that the flight was now delayed to depart at 8 30 pm.

The reason I booked this flight is because I had a connecting Malaysian Airline flight to Kuala Lumpur and then Melbourne which was to depart at 12 20 am on Jan 11th 2024.

So even though we were told that the flight SG 2910 was delayed to 8 30 pm, the flight eventually left at 9 05 pm. I spoke to the ground staff at Mopa explaining that I had a connecting flight to Melbourne and they told me that someone would be there at Bangalore airport to assist.

The flight then landed at Bangalore at 10 45 pm which means that there was a delay over the delay. Due to this, I was not able to reach the Malaysian counter on time and I missed my flight to KL and then Melbourne.

There was no one to assist me from Spice Jet and to add to all the stress and delays, I had to book new air tickets to Bangkok and then to Melbourne.

The total cost of this came to about AUD 1500 and I lost out on my flights that I paid for.

Not just the money list but the stress and anxiety created by them. 

Now they are not willing to even talk to me and offer me even a cent.

I am not sure how the civil aviation authority is allowing these clowns to run an airline like this. If it were Australia, they would have had their licence cancelled.

Please do not fly this airline....

title: Pathetic
text:
I am writing to express my profound dissatisfaction and disappointment with the recent series of incidents that transpired during my journey with SpiceJet Airlines, involving flight delays, misinformation, and a severe lapse in communication. I am hopeful that this grievance will be addressed promptly and that appropriate measures will be taken to rectify the situation.

I, P Vamshi Krishna Reddy, had booked a round-trip ticket with SpiceJet for my travel from Hyderabad to Delhi on January 30, 2024, and return on the same day, with the following details:

Departure: SpiceJet SG 160, Hyderabad to Delhi, PNR No: C6SHFL, Departure Time: 06.00 am (Actual Departure: 8.30 am)
Return: SpiceJet SG 261, Delhi to Hyderabad, PNR No: C6SHFL, Departure Time: 20.55, Revised departure time is 23.30 and then preponed to 22.30

I faced significant inconveniences during both legs of my journey, as the morning flight was delayed by 2.30 hours due to bad weather. Subsequently, the return flight's departure time was preponed without any prior notification, leading to an egregious situation where I missed my flight even though I was waiting for flight in the lounge since 6.00 PM in the airport. Moreover, the airline's operations seemed disorganized, akin to local buses, which is a serious departure from the expected standards of a reputable airline.

The lack of communication and the discrepancy in information provided by SpiceJet staff, particularly Mr. ASIF, Senior Executive, is highly regrettable. Despite my efforts to seek assistance, Mr. ASIF exhibited a negligent attitude, offering no resolution to my predicament and suggesting that I raise a complaint with customer care.

title: A Nightmare Experience with Lost Baggage ‚Äì Avoid SpiceJet at All Costs.
text:
I am compelled to share my horrendous experience with SpiceJet, particularly their appalling handling of my lost baggage. This has been, without exaggeration, the worst airline experience I've ever endured.

During my trip to Mumbai, my baggage was lost. What followed was a two-month ordeal of nearly daily calls to their customer service, which has proven to be a study in frustration and ineffectiveness. The lack of clear information and solutions from SpiceJet was astounding. Each call felt like starting from scratch ‚Äì different versions of the story, no continuity in communication, and an apparent total disconnection between departments.

Their email communication is just as unresponsive. Not a single one of my numerous emails received a reply, leaving me in a constant state of uncertainty about the status of my baggage. It's as if once they lose your luggage, you, as a customer, cease to exist in their system.

The most distressing part is the sheer indifference and inconsistency in their responses. There's a glaring lack of accountability and customer care, making me feel utterly disregarded and helpless. It's been a never-ending loop of unfulfilled promises and conflicting information.

Based on my experience, I strongly advise against using SpiceJet. Their handling of customer issues, particularly lost baggage, is abysmal. No traveler should have to go through what I did. It‚Äôs more than just about lost baggage; it's about a total failure in customer service and respect. Fly with them at your own risk, but if you value your peace of mind and your belongings, look elsewhere.

title: Absolute Nightmare of an airline
text:
Absolutely the worst airline, with obnoxious and rude ground and flight staff. 
Insisted that me and my friend check in expensive camera equipment. In all my time travelling never have i come across such insensitive and  horrible staff. 
While the lady at the counter objected to the weight of my carry on with cameras and lenses, she was quite all right if i carried the same in my hand or shoved a few cameras in my jacket pocket. No other airline would even suggest something so outrageous. 
In my experience Indigo, Vistara, Air India and even Akasa is more than accommodating when they see you are carrying expensive camera gears. 

Oh not to mention the last time i flew Spice jet, which was probably in 2019, they broke my suitcase, and received the response from the ground staff, that a) it was already broken, b) the suitcase brand wasn't a great one. BTW it was a VIP. Sever complaints and follow up's later, I  still haven't heard back from them 

I would never fly spice jet ever again, even if it is the only airline operating to a location, I would take Indian railways over Spice Jet any day.  Once bitten twice should have been my lesson, but late than never.

title: Disappointing Experience with SpiceJet
text:
I recently had a disheartening experience with SpiceJet. My flight on November 28 was delayed by a staggering 6 hours, prompting me to book an alternative with another airline. The real frustration began when I sought a refund for the delayed flight.

Despite daily calls to their customer service, there has been zero progress. The only consistent thing I've received from SpiceJet is false promises that I will get the revert on mail within 6 hours. It's been a month, and I'm still waiting for a revert mail.

This lack of responsiveness and accountability is unacceptable. I expected better service, especially in handling situations involving significant delays. If you value your time and money, think twice before choosing SpiceJet. My experience has been nothing short of disappointing. ‚ö†Ô∏è

I hope this message reaches you. I am writing to inform you of my decision to discontinue traveling with SpiceJet based on recent experiences.

Regrettably, the punctuality issues and inconveniences I have faced during my recent flights have led me to lose confidence in the airline's service reliability. As a result, I have decided to explore alternative options for my future travel needs.

I appreciate the attention to this matter and hope for improvements in the future.

title: The Frustrating Tale of SpiceJet's Continuous Delays
text:
We had pre-booked flight tickets from Delhi to Hyderabad, expecting a 7 am departure. Unfortunately, the flight experienced multiple delays: first pushed to 8 am, then further delayed to 10:50 am, 11 am, and finally 12:15 pm. These continuous delays were quite challenging for us, significantly disrupting our schedule. The airline's inefficiency led to a waste of our precious time. When we requested lounge access due to the prolonged delay, the airline offered a meal instead.

There were murmurs among passengers about SpiceJet's limited staffing and flights, suggesting that they might be playing games with travelers. One unfortunate individual missed their flight and sought assistance from the airline but received no support; instead, they were advised to purchase a new, expensive ticket.

Overall, the lack of support and the series of delays left us deeply dissatisfied. Based on this experience, I strongly advise against booking a flight with SpiceJet, even if they offer enticing deals.

title: A Never-Ending Delay Nightmare with SpiceJet
text:
I recently had the misfortune of flying with SpiceJet, and I feel compelled to share my dreadful experience. The airline's consistently abysmal on-time performance turned what should have been a routine journey into an endurance test.

For several weeks in a row, spicejet flights ( Dubai to kochi and back ) with SpiceJet were plagued by delays ranging from 8 hours to a staggering 4 hours. It seemed as though punctuality was a concept lost on them. Despite the inconvenience caused to passengers, the airline's management displayed a shocking lack of interest in resolving this chronic issue.

If you cherish your time and well-being, I strongly advise against considering SpiceJet, even if you're enticed by the seemingly economical ticket prices. The continuous delays not only tested my patience but also left me stranded at the airport without any timely notice or explanation.

SpiceJet's management team appears to be utterly devoid of any skill when it comes to running an airline efficiently. If spending 8 hours or more waiting aimlessly in an airport terminal is your idea of a perfect travel experience, then by all means, choose SpiceJet. However, for those who value their time and sanity, it's best to steer clear of this airline and explore other options that prioritize passenger satisfaction and punctuality.

title: A 24hour delayed flight without a refund on my cancellation
text: I scheduled my flight for December 20th around 22:00. Initially, I received a notification about a one-hour delay, but later, to my surprise, it was extended to a 24-hour delay. This was concerning as I needed to be in Pune on the 21st for work. Fearing a significant loss if I missed my flight, I had to cancel it by contacting the airline. Despite receiving a recorded message assuring a refund for two passengers, I haven't received it yet. Fortunately, I managed to borrow money to book another flight on the 20th. While IndiGo may occasionally be an hour late, it's still preferable to a 24-hour delay. My first experience with SpiceJet was disappointing, and I won't make the same mistake again.

title: Worst Airline experience
text:
The worst service I've seen in an Indian airline so far. First the flight got delayed an hour. Then we had been waiting in line for the baggage drop for about 1.5 hrs and there were only 2 counters for it. After about 2 hrs since there was another flight that was departing within an hour they started calling in all those passengers and the ones who were standing in line for 2 hrs had to wait another hour. On top of it, the attendant was very rude just getting irritated on all the passengers. Then once all that was done, the flight was supposed to take off at 6.05AM but it only took off at 6.45Am. 

The worst part was that all the passenger detail verifications were being made manually with no computers what so ever and the baggage tags were being written by hand. Since all that was being done manually, when we got to checkin, he kept searching for our name on the printed out roster for about 10 mins until I had to point out that he was looking at a roster that was 2 days old and he went off to search for the latest one. That would've taken another 30 mins of our time. 

Not to mention that the flight seats were so uncomfortable that I couldn't get a shut eye for 5 mins

title: Repeated Cancellations or delayed flights
text:
I don't know if it's my bad luck or the airlines' lousy operations management, but the last 3 times that I have booked SpiceJet flights, ALL of them have either been cancelled or had delays of more than 4 hours. Their operations are highly unreliable. And when you complaint to their customer service - they absolve themselves by saying that they offer you refund/ reschedule options. They dont seem to comprehend that their mismanagement adds additional costs - last minute stay changes, cab changes etc. - that go beyond reimbursing their own fare.

Anyhow - I do not recommend booking a SpiceJet flight if you are travelling for leisure or business, even if they offer cheaper fares. They are likely to end up spoiling the whole experience, and adding up to your overall travel cost.

title: Unethical and Bad Service
text:
I usually travel by Indigo but this time i booked Spicejet as it was saying only 4:30hr of flying time from jammu to hyd, so i booked. That flight turned out to be the worst flight experience i ever had.
1. Flight got delayed from departure ( from 2:15 to 2:50)
2. There was a layover at Delhi which was not mentioned in the ticket/pass. At Jammu airport, they said it will be 30mins layover and i have to remain seated.
3. After reaching Delhi they told me the timing has been changed, so now i have to wait around 3hrs at delhi airport and then board the plane again. So i waited at delhi airport ( they gave a cheap food coupon with only one meal choice , I felt really cheated as i choose spicejet over indigo assuming i will get to destination soon without any layovers.)
4. After reaching Hyd i started waiting for my bag at the belt, the belt stopped and my bag didn't came. There were 4 other people also with me whose bags didn't came, the spicejet guy there said bags are coming in lift as they are fragile ( well none of the bags were fragile ).
5. Bags came in the lift all the people got their bags except me. My bag was not there, they said that one bag has missing tag, ( the tag was ripped and lying on the lift floor) so they stopped it and it will come on the belt again, now i waited for like another half an hour for my bag.
6. Finally my bag came, first thing observed was that the small steel lock on my bag was missing, i asked them and they said "It must have broken somehow". I dont know how a steel lock got broken somehow just by moving b/w planes but at this time. When i confronted the spicejet guy again he started behaving rudely. I was really tired at that point as i was unwell , so i just took a video of my bag (lock missing) and left

The flight is delayed is no reason. The time of delay is never communicated. The duration of delay can ever extend. And the biggest issue is that they won't ever approach ot be available to address the concerns of the passengers.

The response to why the delay happened will be so technical that you will wish to not have asked for it. The staff is rude and arrogant.

In short, avoid this at all costs unless you have nothing to do on the day you wish to fly and are okie to spend time walking around the airport or spend time shopping at the airport.

title: Horrible service and mindless rescheduling of plane

I had to replan my entire day hurriedly and suffered quite a loss due to loss of an entire day. But spicejet did not give any kind of compensation.

On the next day, that is 9th november, we boarded the plane at 10am, which was the scheduled time , but the plane did not take off till 12pm, this caused significant delay and anxiety in all our programmes. The captain did not even have the decency to explain the cause of delay to the passengers. We just sat inside the aircraft clueless for more than 1 hour. 

This horrible kind of service has made me determined not to ever use this goddamned airlines again. Spicejet only thinks of the passengers as money making machines, and it's high time we show them their place.

Flight no SG 516
PNR SF5BNT

title: Avoid if possible
text:
Many weeks in advance I made a 'Confirmed' booking (and paid in full) for SpiceJet flights Delhi-Dharamshala-Delhi. These were part of a 9 day visit to India with my son to watch two England World Cup games, plus a visit to the Taj Mahal. On the back of this booking I had bought train tickets, Taj tickets and hotel bookings. With just a few days' notice SpiceJet sent me a message saying that, due to 'operational reasons', my flight back from Dharamshala had been pushed back a day. This threw my carefully-planned itinerary into chaos and cost me a significant sum in unused/replacement tickets and hotel bookings. When I phoned SpiceJet to complain I was left with the clear impression that mine was not an unusual experience. This is the first time in my life (I am 64 years old and reasonably well-travelled) that an airline has simply cancelled a confirmed booking, with very little notice and no meaningful apology ("We apologise for any inconvenience"). I would suggest people use an alternative airline such as IndiGo/Vistara (if available) to avoid a similar experience to mine. 
The flights themselves were fine, just not the return flight time I had booked.

title: Worst Experience of Spicejet Flight.
text:
Worst Experience

I had an extremely disappointing experience with SpiceJet SG 8264 flight from Port Blair to Kolkata. Firstly, the flight was canceled without any apparent reason after  04hrs boarding, causing a lot of inconvenience and frustration. To make matters worse, not a single morsel of food or even a cup of water was provided during the entire ordeal. 

What's even more frustrating is that the flight was rescheduled more than 24 hours late, compounding the misery of passengers who were left stranded and unattended for an extended period of time. This kind of service is completely unacceptable, and I would strongly advise against choosing SpiceJet for your travel needs.

The behaviour of cabin crew/ flight attendant is also worst.

title: Shame and only Shame Spicejet
text:
I would like to start by saying WHAT A HUGE Disappointment spicejet!

I booked an air ticket from Bangalore to Delhi on 20th Oct 2023 @ 5:30 AM which was again delayed by 45 mins (PNR F9L46C) which I booked long back with an amount of INR 9023. (Please view the attachment)

On a happy note I started my journey to the airport I got a call saying the flight is being cancelled. Not just 48 hours at least before 24 hours this information could have been passed. No you guys will not do that since you are having a good customer relationship and service as well.

You guys were not even ready to schedule another flight and take care of the passengers. I called the customer care and even begged the employee in the airport to reschedule another flight or to at least to another flight (in which there are another flight at 2:30 AM in the same date flight SG 8136 where my friends were traveling) or other airlines. Later on, few of my co-passengers were able to get seats in the 2.30 am flight which was very unfair and unethical.

I had a very personal emergency to reach Delhi as soon as possible before early afternoon. I had NO OTHER OPTION TO BOOK ANOTHER FLIGHT costing INR 21,551 which is 3x that which I paid. (Please view the attachment)

This situation happened to me only because of your irresponsibility and the mistake that you all had done. From this  point I made my mind not ever in my life to use this airlines anymore.

title: Financially draining experience
text:
SpiceJet may cancel a flight 30 mins before departure without any prior notice and expects the passengers to be fine with it. They will not provide any accommodation or proper refreshments even if the next alternate flight is after 12hrs.
They will give you bogus reply and try to make up things.
Next time if you are thinking of travelling via Spicejet you may as well be prepared to be stranded in the airport and pay the exorbitant price of accomodation and make arrangements for alternate travel plans from your own pocket.
When you contact customer service they will say they will look into it and then you will not get any reply afterwards. 
In Air Seva they just make up excuses and then mark the grivence as resolved.
Be carefully and cautious while choosing Spicejet.
Also while going through the reviews for Spicejet you will find most people rating Spicejet as excellent has only 1 contribution. I can expect some people finding only Spicejet as excellent is possible but for so many people, I don't know  it's fishy? Maybe only my opinion. And also 1-3 excellent reviews mostly come right after someone's terrible review. Not in all cases and most they do. Anyone can check the chronology of the reviews to verify.

title: Worst experience Nightmare
text:

I booked ticket through Spicejet,From Mumbai to Darbhanga.the time of the flight was 6:30 in the morning.I did not sleep at the night so that I could reach on time to the Mumbai Airport.From Vasai i booked a cab at around 3 Am & left.But I was stuck in the Mumbai Traffic.still my cab driver made it fast but i reached Wrong terminal at 5:45 Am. I got call from Spicejet attendant .they said I was on wrong terminal.i said them to wait 10 minutes so that I could reach there.They denied.at 6:2-6:5 I was on the boarding pass counter.i requested them a lot but they didn't allow me to Bord. I asked them for the refund.but they denied & said no refund policy.i said them to manage me in the next flight.the denied,Said you will have to buy the new ticket which was double the price. 
Can anyone say it was really a falt or Companies misbehaving attitude. Now if there was some big face or a big polliticians,or Any big business person, would it be a same policy for them too?.
I will try my best to not travel through Spicejet in the future.My work experience through Spicejet. You choose your flight wisely.

title: SpiceJet doesn't have a great track record when it comes to quality customer service do not book spicejet
text:
this letter to make a complaint regarding misguided, misinformation, poor service , Discrimination, harsh staff and spicejet flight delay of (SG-8184) from Pune to (New Delhi).It is the first time that I have faced such cases. Passengers buy expensive tickets because they have important work to do or to be at their desired place for an important reason. But I guess you people do not consider our engagements or tasks important.

I had a ticket from Pune to Delhi then Delhi to Kangra Gaggal. Unfortunately the flight got delay and was not aware as I am employee in hotel where management do not allowed us to carry phone on duty.
I have called to spicejet customer care at 09:18pm on 4th sept to know the status and one of your crew members stated over the phone that flight will depart from Pune at 2:30am on 5th September early morning which was incorrect information I received . I reached at the airport by 12:50am and asked to airport crew staff from where I need to go to spicejet. He has mentioned that from last gate. I was in the line and it was long line. I asked again one more crew staff and he mentioned I need to go to inside from first entry gate from where you sent (almost I lost all time there becouse my mistake was asking help from your crew staff) I rushed to the direction then I stopped by police and said me to show the ticket. I have presented my ticket on the phone but he did not understand and asked me more details (again wasted my time, please go through CC tv camera. Allmost I have lost my valuable time.

Then I went to check in counter and with me there were three more passengers (1 lady and two guy) at the same time they allowed to travel but they denied me. I was shell shocked and thought why discrimination with me ???? At check in counter there were two crew guy and one girl apart from one guy was very peevish & harsh behaviour. (If I am not wrong Gate closes 45 Minutes before departure.pls understand the valu of seconds as well). title: Spicejet's Ruthless & Illegal Conduct and Worst Customer Service
text:
I recently booked a ticket from Chennai to Delhi on 6th September 2023. But, sadly I had to encounter the worst experience with Spicejet, where I was denied onboarding on a mere request of writing only 2 words on the excess baggage receipt - "Laptop Bag" after payment of the excess baggage charges for the laptop bag that I was carrying. Such conduct from Spicejet was very unprofessional and dissatisfactory. When a customer pays the ticket price, he owns the right to travel through the flight and taking away this right is illegal in all terms. I can not understand if there is a policy of spicejet to charge amounts for a laptop bag, what made the team cancel my onboarding on the request of adding these 2 words - "Laptop Bag" on the excess baggage charge payment receipt. 

To my utmost surprise, when I raised this with Spicejet's escalation points, they are saying that I have only refused to travel and they did not deny onboarding. This is completely false, as any sensible person can vouch for it - if I would have to refuse travel I would not have even paid the excess baggage charges in the first instance. This is a pure betrayal from spicejet. Atleast, they should have the guts to accept what they did.

I then also went to google to check on the reviews of Spicejet where I found that many customers faced the similar issue where they were denied onboarding by Spicejet staff and then Spicejet later took their steps back to say they did not deny the onboarding.

Because of them I was left helpless but to book another flight late in that day. I had to reach Delhi urgently but because of Spicejet staff, this was unduly delayed. They have even refused to refund the ticket price.

title: Disheartening Experience - Unprofessional Staff and Unreasonable Charges
text:
My recent journey with Spice Jet airline from Calicut to Dubai was a complete disappointment. The check-in process was marred by unprofessional behavior from the staff. We encountered an unfortunate experience with the staff, who displayed aggression and utter disrespect towards passengers.
Adding to the distress, the staff demanded an exorbitant additional charge for our luggage, including an unreasonable claim for my baby's stroller, which we had previously taken on the same route without any problems during our outbound flight. This inconsistency and unjustified charge left us deeply dissatisfied.
Despite providing proof of double payment, Spice Jet is yet to refund the excessive amount they charged us under duress. It is disheartening to see an airline of this stature failing to provide basic customer satisfaction.
I sincerely hope Spice Jet takes immediate action and thoroughly trains their staff to treat passengers with respect and empathy. As loyal customers, we expect a better travel experience and fair treatment. This incident has left me questioning whether I should ever consider flying with Spice Jet again.

title: Spice Jet - A bunch of thieves
text:
Spice Jet is a bunch of crooks and fraudsters. We travelled from Dubai to Ahmedabad on 30th June 2023 and out of 5 checked in bags, we received only 4 at Ahmedabad airport. The ground officer wrote a complaint and said that there is nothing to worry as everyday 50-100 bags go missing. He said this so casually as if it was a joke.

Very disappointed we left from there and received a call after 2 days that the bag was found and would be delivered to our address. But shockingly when we checked the bag, many things were missing.

Since then, we have been following up with them but they hardly respond.  And now they came up saying that they have checked the CCTV, the bag was safely loaded from Dubai Airport in the same flight. So if it was in the same flight, why was it not loaded on the belt? They have no answer to this question as it is a clear case of theft. The bag was purposely held at Ahmedabad airport so that they could steal the imported stuff and return it to us 2 days later. We are international passengers so imagine the discomfort we had to go through as many important things were in the bag. We came to spend joyous summer vacation in India but this is the welcome we got, I request government authorities to take strict action as unethical behaviors like this may effect tourism in India.

Please check the reviews I have attached below and you will see that many passengers faced the similar issues. I wonder how the government did not take any action if so many reviews have been posted against them. The only regret is that I should have called the police at the airport instead of trusting them and leaving the airport.

Please guys be careful while booking your next flight with these fraudsters!! If missing bags is a normal thing for them, expect them to go to any level.

title: The worst company that can ruin your trip Try to buy ticket from the other company with better responsabilit√†.
text:
We took a flight from Delhi to Srinagar, the flight was delayed, when we arrived my luggage did not arrive, there was no official to take responsibility for this.  Only one guy who didn't speak English gave us a receipt and said to call tomorrow.  The next day, no one answered our calls until they answered in the afternoon and said one suitcase has arrived, but we don't know if yours, come see,if it's yours?  We go to the airport and collect the luggage, BUT what happened? my things are lost.  My boots, jacket and trekking gear.  There is no one to follow up on the situation, two boys who have no command of English observe our wandering in silence. One they way of back the guy who call Ashish gave his number to us to follow up.on the first day, he answered and said that he will call us until the evening, but he did not. On the second day, he answered our call and said that he would follow up and call us, but he did not answer. On the third day, I realized that he had blocked our number. 
Today, when I am writing this comment, 24 days have passed and I am trying more than 40 emails and calling different numbers more than 3 times a day.  No one is taking responsibility, I am not looking for my belongings because I believe that with this mess no one can find my items, but I am asking for a confirmation so that I can use my insurance.  Today is the 25th day that they gave a similar reply to my email, saying that I should have left my valuables in my handbag.  Yes, don't forget you have to carry your boots, jacket and trekking gear in hand luggage.  They have not even given me a confirmation for the luggage delay.  Our entire trip to Kashmir was ruined because of this company's irresponsibility.
With 500 rupees we could take IndiGo, but we didn't because of timetable, after all this happened, I understood IndiGo offers you different times, if you go directly to their site, so for return we took IndiGo and it was WoW with totally different services.

title: Read this before you fly with them.
text:
Spice jet is the worst airline ive ever been. 

They are not trustworthy of handling luggages; first they did not inform me that my luggage were not on board with me even tho I check-in early and were at airport for more than an hour. 

When I got to destination they asked me to sign agreement to open my luggage cus there were "restricted item". The funny thing is, i flew spicejet just one day before this trip from Dharamshala to delhi - which they didnt detect there were any restricted item, i didnt even open my bag because if was just one night then i go to Leh.

However, they open my bag and search all my personal belongings which got really messy and dirty on my things (there were black stains like petrol or sth i cant even wash it off). My new backpack was also scratched and cut, the whole bag become super dirty and apparently not being handle with respect. 

*When i received my bag the second day, i ask them what have they took out and what kind of item i have that were restricted? The staff replies: e-cigerettes!

TOTAL LIAR, I DONT EVEN SMOKE!!!!!! ---- they didnt find anything, they just try to blame it on me for what is wrong for them! they didnt inform me my bag has problem --- if they delay my bag just bring back to me why do you need me to sign off that agreement and touch my personal things and get them so dirty and messy????????????????????? 

I am so frustrated and pissed with the way they handle this, please do not fly with them. If you search a little on google - just type spicejet and DGCA then you can see how sloppy they were on so many aspect. 

DGCA notes to Spicejet on Feb 2023: 

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) had issued a notice to SpiceJet for ‚Äúpoor internal safety oversight and inadequate maintenance‚Äù that resulted in ‚Äúdegradation of safety margins‚Äù.

Do not waste your money and risk your safty on this careless airline.

title: Fix the credit card swipe machine .
text: There is a difference in the baggage limit on international and Domestic. I am aware of that.  I am a NRI and visiting India after 5 years. I have booked additional baggage but the rule regarding excess baggage was confusing in the website so I decided to pay during the check-in . Check in process started at 7:30 am. The staff mentioned I have to get additional package and pay more for excess. Total cost was 19500. I gave my travel credit card the same card used for booking. It is premium card and I can get back my luggage expenses. Unfortunately non of my credit cards go through. I called the bank and they said they didn‚Äôt receive any transactions. I did have enough rupee and I could pay using the website. The staff escorted me to arrival gate to the exchange and after lot of struggle and loss I got the money and paid . They whole process took 2 hours . Then the staff demanded me to show my pan card because it was cash transaction. Luckily I had the pan card with me in one of my luggage .I came home after 5 years and the check in process was not pleasant. I could be avoided if those credit card machine was working or able to do we checking and pay online. I lost so much money on the currency conversion and I can‚Äôt reimburse the baggage allowance because I didn‚Äôt use my card.  Staffs at Chennai airport were helpful. But they can‚Äôt help with the spice jet IT infrastructure failures.

title: delay in flights a constant feature
text:
I was travelling from Abu Dhabi to India for attending the funeral of my close aunt and unfortunately spice jet was showing online to be the only airline to travel on the domestic sector from Delhi to Jammu to reach in time for the final rites
Guess what at 5.30 am I received a sms that the flight is rescheduled and I rush to their counter at T3 ( next to Indigo, from where I actually bought my second ticket to reach home in time to see my aunt for the last time) , staff at the spice jet booth say sorry you can only checkout on the app or call the customer service 
As you would be aware that check-in has been made mandatory on domestic flights in India so one cannot opt out of it if one has to fly 
So I try on the app it gives me a technical error and says call customer service so at 5.40 am I am trying to find an alternative at the airport and also tried to check out of the flight and cancel but no luck
 
I sent a mail to customer care attaching their message on the app and they refused to refund saying to send us the call log to validate that I did call 
Before also on the domestic sector I faced a similar issue while travelling from Delhi to Goa but I was able to get in touch with customer service as it was afternoon time
They will always show a fare which is lower than other airlines and then due to operational reasons delay flights better to pay more than travel with them

title: Worst ever flight, should avoid at all cost.
text:
I traveled on Spicejet flight no SG15 on AMD/DXB Route, and both my checked-in luggage bags have been damaged by their handling staff, we have got the damage report also from Dubai Airport, and made an official complaint to Spicejet via email.

They did promise us a refund of only INR 2,000/- (2 bags' combined value was around INR 16,000/- and both bags were brand new and purchased from Dubai), they asked us to submit the Bank Details so they can process the Refund, which we already did, but to date, we have not received anything.

As of today, in June 2023, it's almost 6 months, after giving repeated reminders on the refund that they have promised, but to date we have not received anything, and now they are not even replying to email.

And this is not the first time that we have received damaged baggage from SpiceJet, it has happened earlier as well, but that time I was new in Dubai, and not much aware of how we can claim the damage, so didn't make any complaints.

Worst ever flight, should avoid at all cost.

title: Cabin Crew Appreciation

I had a spicejet flight from Jaipur to Amritsar - SG- 2941on 18/06/2023

The name of the cabin crew is Ms. Shilpi Sharma, i was sitting all the way behind on my seat no. 21 C and randomly, I noticed her because of her continous attentiveness and politeness towards all the pessengers, The humble way to insist passangers to wear there seat belts and water requirement.

Not only her perfect way of working, but her dressing up of uniform, and Mask were also perfectly put up.

Despite, the flight was completely packed up and having Just 2 crews, Her Continous prompt actions of serving to the passengers were so perfect, And by seeing her dedciation towards her work, got me to put up an appreciation mail for your team. Really team like these, make a far step further then travelling with any other reputated airlines.

Even the second Crew treated so well and served perfectly to all the pessengers.

Want to thank your entire team for making my journey so comfortable and safe.

I do regularly fly and will surely fly in my coming times with spice jet.

Best Regards,
Navneet Kumar
Environment Consultant
Ministry of Environment,Forest & Climate Change

title: Flight time change and loss of money as well as working days
text:
We are family of 3 and had booked a flight to Guwahati from Mumbai for 6.10 AM for Wednesday 17th May 2023. PNR number S6E2NB. It was supposed to reach around 10. We had an onwards journey to Shillong. When we tried to check in, we realised that flight has changed to evening 19.00 hrs. To avoid losing a day in Shillong, we had to book a day prior and had to book a stay in Guwahati. Spent around 20k more. This flight was delayed by 30 min.

On our return journey, we had a ticket from Guwahati for 17.10 hrs on 21st May 2023 with PNR number LIQS4E. Reaching Mumbai back at 20.30 hrs same day. While we tried checking in previous day, we learnt that flight time has changed to 23.30 hrs. And reaching back at 3.00 AM on next day. We had no choice as other airline flights were not available for 3 people or exorbitantly expensive. We had to continue   and checked in. The flight was delayed from scheduled 23.30 hrs on 21st May to 00.45 AM on 22nd May. We have landed on T2 terminal at 4.20 AM.

We have lost sleep, money and an entire of work day pre travel and post travel. We have barely slept. They have offered a sandwich and Rajma Chawl at the airport. It is a hardship which we will never forget and not recommend spicejet airline to anyone.

The leg space between chair is extremely low. An average height person like us was hitting knee to the seat ahead. Extremely bad experience both ways. There was no courtesy shown to us by spicejet ground staff and cabin crew. Just a customary apology was given.

We will never recommend Spicejet airlines to anyone. If there was a zero star or negative star to rate, would have picked it to rate the service.

title: Om Namah Venkateshaya
text: Hurma  and Mousumi flight attendants, special thanks to both,for providing our needs .Flight attendants play a crucial role in ensuring the safety and comfort of passengers during air travel. They are responsible for providing excellent customer service, managing emergency situations, and enforcing safety protocols. A good flight attendant should be friendly, approachable, and knowledgeable about their job. They should also be able to remain calm under pressure and think on their feet in unexpected situations. Additionally, attention to detail, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work well in a team are essential traits for any flight attendant. Overall, a great flight attendant can make all the difference in a passenger's experience and contribute to a successful flight.

title: A memorable Journey with unforgettable moments through Spice Jet
text:
I am a frequent traveler over the Bay of Bengal and I have travelled through different domestic airlines on different occasion. However, this review meant for my  recent travelling experience with Spice Jet (SG-869). 

On 12th May 2023, I had the pleasure of embarking on an extra ordinary journey with spice jet. I must say it was an experience that exceeded all my expectation. As followed its earlier reputation, this time have also sets a new standards its customer services at everywhere like, from the Check-in counter to the flights attendants. 

To speaking about cabin crews, I was met with warm demeanor and their highest stands of professionalism. They were always ready to assist with any query or any concerns of matter that faced by the passenger on board which making me feel valued and comfortable. Moreover, they were so proactive through their gesture that you can say, they were one step ahead beyond customer and cabin crews‚Äô official relation boundaries.

The Interior design of spice Jet is very decorative, the seats were spacious and economically designed. In addition to, the cabin was very clean and well maintained which created a pleasant atmosphere. Apart from that, The Jet have hold In-flight Magazine through which you can gain your perspective plan into the pursuit of unknown places.

The flights adhered to schedule, ensuing on time departures and arrivals.  This reliability provided peace of mind and allowed me to plan my next travel with ease and I greatly appreciated their commitment to valuing their passenger time.

In conclusion, I want to personally give thanks to all four-cabin member, specially to Ms RIMI. She hold exude grace and charm carrying personality herself with poise & sophistication like other attendants of Spice Jet.  Her careful nature and friendliness behaviors create an irresistible combination with high standards of professionalism which instill confidences in passengers and such type of unexpected gesture definitely embedded a long lasting impression which should call someone for boarding again with spice Jet in their future travel

title: Excellent support from Ground Staff
text:
I would like to take a moment to express my utmost appreciation and gratitude towards the outstanding service provided by the ground staff members of SpiceJet, Anuka Goshal, and Rajkumar. Their assistance during a stressful situation at the Siliguri airport truly exceeded all expectations and deserves recognition. My wife and I found ourselves caught in a dreadful traffic jam in Siliguri, which resulted in a significant delay in reaching the airport. With only 30 minutes left for our flight's departure, we were understandably anxious and worried about making it on time. However, as soon as we arrived at the airport, Anuka and Rajkumar ensured that our check-in and security process went smoothly and efficiently. Despite the time constraint and the pressure they were under, Anuka and Rajkumar displayed remarkable professionalism and composure. They handled our check-in baggage swiftly, ensuring that we didn't have to worry about any extra delays. Moreover, they guided us through the security check process, making sure we complied with all necessary procedures without wasting any time. Their willingness to go above and beyond to assist us during a challenging situation was truly commendable. Their friendly and reassuring demeanor helped alleviate our stress and made us feel valued as customers. It was evident that they genuinely cared about our well-being and ensured that we didn't miss our flight.

Not only did Anuka and Rajkumar demonstrate exceptional efficiency and professionalism, but they also showcased their excellent problem-solving skills. They remained calm and composed, quickly adapting to the circumstances and finding solutions to any potential obstacles that arose. Their dedication and commitment to customer service are truly praiseworthy. Despite the time pressure, they didn't compromise on the quality of their assistance. Their attention to detail and thoroughness were evident throughout the entire process, leaving us with a lasting positive impression. 

SpiceJet should be proud to have such exceptional employees representing their brand. Anuka and Rajkumar's outstanding service has left a lasting impression on me, and I will not hesitate to recommend SpiceJet to others based on my experience with them.

title: Flight cancellation by spice Jet airlines
text: We booked two seats on Spice Jet for the flight to Khajuraho on 19th April 2023. We were flying to New Delhi from abroad, to land in Delhi in the morning of  19th April. Our plan was to start a two week tour of Madhya Pradesh and another state, then return home. Hotels, guides, safaris, further flights were booked and paid for. On 17th April,in the evening,  I logged in to web check-in, and found to my great concern that spice Jet had booked me for a flight to Khajuraho on 20th April instead. When I called their office, I was told the flight for 19th April had been cancelled and passengers had been booked for 20th April instead! Without their knowledge or permission!!! I called my travel agent, he told me this was a common occurrence with Spice Jet they had a tendency to suddenly cancel flights when they felt the flight was inadequately full, and they were known for this impudent behaviour towards the customer. Just what did they think I was to do with a whole day  and night spent at Delhi airport, at no notice?  What about the disruption to my other plans for my holiday? I wrote to them, they refunded the cost of the ticket, refused to compensate for other costs incurred-- I had to book a very costly flight at short notice to another city, then book a taxi to drive me for 6-hours to Khajuraho. The problem was  that only Spice Jet flew on 19th April in the afternoon to Khajuraho, certainly they were aware of that. Otherwise I would have been most reluctant to book with them. After this awful experience, I shall AVOID booking with Spice Jet, and would never recommend them to anyone.

title: worst people of airlines
text:
I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration with the way your staff treated us during our recent experience with your airline. On 4th April, six of us had a scheduled flight from Mumbai to bagdugra at 1 pm. Due to heavy traffic on the road, we were unfortunately delayed in check in time by just 10 minutes which had departure time after 50 minutes of our arrival.
However, instead of showing any compassion or understanding towards our situation, your staff members were extremely rude and unhelpful. They refused to let us board the flight, even though we explained the circumstances of our delay and begged them to reconsider. To our utter shock and dismay, they insisted that our tickets were wasted and that we had to purchase new ones for a later flight.

This was a huge inconvenience for all six of us, as we were not only forced to reschedule our plans but also incurred a significant financial loss due to having to buy new tickets for 50 thousand INR. It is extremely unfair and unjust that six passengers had to suffer just because we were delayed by a mere 10 minutes. Moreover, it is disheartening to see that your airline does not prioritize customer satisfaction and instead treats passengers with such disrespect and contempt.

We expect a prompt and appropriate response from your customer service team regarding this matter. We hope that your airline takes necessary measures to ensure that such incidents do not happen in the future, and that passengers are treated with the respect and care that they deserve.

We had booked a hotel room at Karwaan Jaisalmer 5 stars hotel, due to the cancellation of our flight, we were unable to cancel our accommodation last minute. Moreover, we had organised a driver on the same day.

text: Very bed service, if you have other options, avoid spicejet. One of the many reason is, shopping from duty free is considered under cabin luggage weight and if over their allowed limit, they will charge extra for duty free shipping.

title: The worst flight I ever had
text:
I have been flying for almost two decades by different airlines but I had the worst customer experience as well as scheduling experience by a flight company - Spicejet- last week.
I was at the airport around 10am for 12.55pm flight and was advised it's rescheduled for next day 12.15am. I had come travelling by 4 flights and it was the last phase of my trip. I had no where to go as I had already checked out of the hotel and waiting in the airport. The time was rescheduled several times since then and finally took off only after 2am. I checked with the staff but no support or meal coupon was offered. However in the flight I came to know atleast 4 co-passengers were offered free entry to the lounge and had meals as they "fought" for it ... but I didn't know how to fight. 
The worst experience was when I asked for a Form -D for immigration purpose. The ground staff didn't know what it was but were helpful  in checking and confirmed it's available in the flight but when I asked the flight staff, at first she didn't get what it was and then straight away said "it's not our responsibility" in a very rude way. I tried to explain what the ground staff informed me but she was not willing to listen but started to stair at me as if I did a crime by asking for it. I told her that I can't stand her attitude and turned my face. After the meals were served, I asked if I could have another juice but the same staff told she already gave me a "complementary" drink. I mentioned that I paid for the meals and how come the drink that comes with it becomes "complementary". She seemed very agitated and started shouting "did I do anything wrong to you" three times. I saw her colleague was trying to calm her down and I prayed and kept my temper and turned my face. Never trust this airline and make your plans.
Mel-Mat23

title: Late again, slightly better than outbound flight, but never fly with SpiceJet again
text:
Tuesday 28th February and we were booked to travel on SpiceJet flight SG 454 from Dabolim Airport, Goa to Mumbai.

We were due to depart at 13.05 arriving at 14.20, at Terminal 2, a scheduled flight time of one hour and fifteen minutes.

We were able to check in online just under forty-eight hours before departure and            e-boarding cards were issued. It is a mandatory requirement to check-in prior to departure.

We did receive a call and text from the Airline the day before our departure advising us that the flight was delayed until 14.50. While this was not the best news, at least we were aware and able to reschedule our taxi pick up.

When we checked in at the airport, the information board showed a departure time of 14.50 but the status showed that the flight was delayed. This changed to 15.15 at some stage.

We eventually started boarding the flight at 15.03 which completed by 15.30, it was a slow laborious process.

The aircraft pushed back from the Terminal at 15.38 and was finally airborne at 15.51, which was an hour later than the rescheduled departure time.

As we borded we were handed a small of water. During an announcement we were advised that the flight time would be an hour.

Shortly after take-off the crew passed the cabin distributing food to those passengers that had pre-ordered it. They also offered other passengers the opportunity to purchase snacks and soft drinks.
A couple of plus points, the cabin was clean and the legroom was not bad at all. It looked like a reasonably new aircraft, Boeing 737 Max8. However,  it was freezing cold in the cabin despite wearing a hooded top.

We landed 16.51 with a good bang on the breaks. The aircraft came to a halt at a spot on the tarmac at 16.58, from there we were bussed to the terminal where we arrived at 17.18. We picked up our cases at 17.30.

We landed two and a half hours later than our original scheduled landing.

Before landing the captain made an announcement apologised for the delay, supposedly due to technical difficulties. This was a bit incredulous as every SpiceJet flight due to depart today, from Goa, was delayed some as late as seven hours. Definitely an airline to be avoided
The name of the aircraft was Green Chili, in keeping with the Spice theme.

Our original SpiceJet flight,  from Mumbai to Goa on the 26th January was an even worse experience.

title: Fraud on excess bag policy
text:
I had a flight from Dubai to Delhi on 1st March 2023,  There were 2 passengers on same PNR. I have multiple complaints for this flight.

1) We had a total limit of 60 kg check in and we actually checked in approx 52 Kgs of weight and we had 21 kg of weight for the cabin.  During airplane boarding, I was charged 420 AED for an extra 7 kg of weight. At the time of check in, I was not told that there will be a charge at the gate for that extra 7 kg weight. If you had clearly communicated this during baggage drop, I would have adjusted my extra 7 kg. There is a complete lack of communication from spicejet end. Even though I was within the allowed total weight limit , I was charged an extra 420 AED. What happens next is even more bizarre. After taking 420 AED at the boarding gate, the spicejet executive took 1 of my bags (equal to 7 Kg) from me and took it to check-in. So, i was not even allowed to take excees 7 Kg from the Cabin.Long story short, My total checking bags were 59 Kg and my cabin bags were 14 kg. (Both within limits) and I was charged 420 AED.

2) My apathy does not stop here, There is more. I have received one of my checked-in bags as broken. 

3) Well, my apathy does not stop here, During the booking, I was charged 3 times for booking and I had sent an email to ask for a refund of two charges. I am waiting for a response on that email for 2 weeks. They are so fast to collect money from customer fraudulently and so slow on refunding customer money.

In total,I had a total nightmare experience with spicejet. Avoid it at all cost.

title: Horrible experience, please read
text: I am horribly disappointed with this airline. The baggage drop was very inconsistent and we were overcharged almost $100 USD for our luggage. The staff were arguing with each other over the policy as we watched others with equally sized carry on baggage walk through without issue. We were not offered any clarity or help on this issue after asking several times. Our previous flight was also canceled the day of leading to almost $500 USD in extra charges for us to reroute ourselves. We still have not received any refund. I will be canceling all future flights with spice jet and encouraging others to do the same.

title: SPICEJET IS THE MOST IRRESPONSIBLE AND PATHETIC AIRLINES IN OUR COUNTRY.
text: On 24th February 2023, I had to travel to Dharamshala  for which I had booked Spicejet Airlines which was going to fly Dharamshala via Delhi, having a 2hr45min layover at Delhi Airport (PNR QEZ8FG). On 21st February 23, I was intimated by Spicejet that my flight was rescheduled and inspite of knowing that I was a single woman traveling with a 3year boy, they had put me on a combination of flight which required a stayover at Delhi Airport to catch next day 6.55 am flight to Dharamshala. Later considering my request I was put on 25th Feruary flight. On 24th Feb itself the flight got rescheduled twice because of which my layover at Delhi Airport got reduced to 1hour. The Spicejet staff at Delhi Airport was JUST HORRIBLE, they literally made me and my son run at the airport, to exit from terminal 3, take bus and rush to terminal 1 to board the flight to Dharamshala, the staff was horribly rude and inconsiderate. My Baby couldn't run along and when I requested the Spicejet staff to help me carry my bag, for me to hold my son, my request was bluntly denied. After reaching  Dharamshala, I didn't receive my bags, after checking with the staff, I was been told that they have forgotten my bags at Delhi Airport, and that I will receive them next day itself. I was feeling so helpless that I literally started crying at the airport, I had no clothes for me and my son, no winter wear and most importantly my baby's food, since he is allergic to few food ingredients, I always carry homemade ready to cook food suitable for him. That whole day till 10am next morning I had to deprive my son off his daily food. Next day the bags which we received were also damaged. This experience with  SPICEJET has caused severe mental agony and trauma to me and my 3year old son. Spicejet has absolutely ruined this precious trip for me and my son. I really wonder why SPICEJET has appointed such useless staff Ms. Meenu Thapa and Ms. Devyani Singh at Dharamshala Airport, they had nothing to say apart from "Sorry, hum kuch nahi kar sakte". I thought in India it would be easy for a single mother to travel with a child, but travelling by SPICEJET IS THE WORST NIGHTMARE one can ever experience.

title: Horrible Experience. Our Bags were left in Dubai
text:
We flew Dubai from Mumbai on 1st Feb flight number SG 14, PNR - UDPHUJ. On arrival at Mumbai 0630 hrs and after waiting for 45 min for our luggage, we were informed that our 6 bags were off-loaded in Dubai itself. We were not alone, there were 20-30 passengers who did not get their bag. The person who was giving the information was extremely rude when passengers asked for the reason for missing bags.  Instead of responding to the concerns of passengers, he kept on arguing with them. 
We were then give some forms to fill with bags description, house address, contact details etc. We were told that bags will be delivered within a day. We waited for 2 days and did not get any call, no one answered the calls at airport. We had to send a family family to the airport . We had business travel so we couldn't go ourselves. In the form, this person was authorised to collect the bags on our behalf. 
The family member had to wait at the airport for 3 hours and was told there is only 1 bag out of 6 bags has been identified. Rest of the bags were untraceable. 1 bag we got was broken. The staff was completely ignorant our concerns and continue to misbehave with the family member when asked why the bags are taking so much longer. 
We again went to the airport next day to collect the remaining 5 bags and this process again took 2 hrs. 
So much of harassment is completely unacceptable. 
WE WANT A COMPENSATION FOR ALL THE TROUBLES, EXPENSES TO GO TO THE AIRPORT, TIME SPENT AT THE AIRPORT, BROKEN BAG.

title: No value for passenger's time Or care
text: The airlines made me and my family along with all the other passengers wait a long time on the aerobridge despite already making us wait in a long line at the boarding gate as well. title: Need to understand the value of customer's time
text: We booked flight from jabalpur to Pune and return as well. The day before our flight back from Pune to jbp we got revised timings message due to some operational issues. The next day just few hours before our flight we got to know that the flight has been cancelled from spicejet end, reason being the same operational issues. It led to a lot of panic since we had no other options for direct flight from Pune to jabalpur that day. The journey turned out to be so hectic and made us so upset since we had to rush to the airport to catch a flight from Pune to nagpur that too double the price and then from there to jabalpur by train. So please think twice before you decide to travel by spicejet atleast between these cities where there are only few direct flights that also from spicejet. Moreover if you contact their customer support they will not provide any guarantee that the next schedule will not be cancelled, leaving you with no other option. So please have back up plan in place.

title: WORST EXPERIENCE WITH AN AIRLINE
text:
I was supposed to be flying out from Dubai to Mumbai on the 18th of December. My flight was initially booked for the 13th of December, however on the 11th of December I made the change in my flight ticket on the Spice Jet website to fly on the 18th of December. I have a credit card charge to confirm this change as well. I checked on the Spice Jet website on the 17th and it said that the flight is on the 13th of December, however I had already PAID for a change in this flight. 
I had to be in Mumbai for some important family issues and the only thing the agents kept telling me was that there's nothing they could do. When I asked for a manager or supervisor they had every excuse available, from no supervisor would be able to help me, to there's no one in the office, to anything they could to keep me from getting on the phone with some sort of manager or supervisor or anyone. I had to buy another ticket last minute and spend a lot of money on a flight. 
When I initially called Spice Jet and spoke to the customer care executive, she said all I would have to do is write an email and you would refund me the money right away. I have been calling Spice Jet almost every single day and all I have been hearing is that it is coming, then someone said that Spice Jet has issued a refund but they can't tell me the amount, then someone else said that they assured me in 24 hours I would get a response to my email saying that I would get a refund but then when I called back they said oh no wait for 72 hours. Every single time I waited, I never got a single response. I have had to call back and explain the situation EVERY single time. They have consistently refused to give any sort of solution to this issue. They've been giving me the run around for 2 months now, and I still haven't gotten anything. 
This is the first time I flew with Spice Jet but I can say with conviction I will NEVER work with Spice Jet again. 
There was not even any communication from Spice Jet regarding this supposed no-show. If someone had contacted me, even sent me an email about this, then at least I would have 5 days to get some sort of solution before I had to fly. 
At this point, I just want a refund from SpiceJet so that I can finally stop dealing with them.

title: Worst Service
text: I haven't come across a worse service than the one offered by SpiceJet. SpiceJet really needs to start managing its check-in counters better. The staff at the airport just shrugged, showing zero sympathy. I entered the terminal 2 airport 1 hour 45 minutes prior, but the check-in counter was closed. I didn't even get to board my flight, and there was no information shared with me at all about online check-in. Besides all the promo mail, there wasn't any mail about online check-in. Instead, they let me all the way through to the gate and told me on the last moment that I was supposed to check-in, and the website was also not clear in that (I checked). The check-in counter was closed, and they didn't do anything for me other than tell me that I should have known somehow. Also, the flight was delayed for no reason. The flight departure time was 7:20 PM, but it was delayed by 26 minutes. No partial refund; no later flight instead; nothing. only telling me that I should have known somehow what the procedure is and pointing to the terms and conditions part on my e-ticket, which by the way says nothing about checking in. Be aware of this. No spice jet for me anymore.

title: Scam company
text:
I‚Äôm travelling from several months and 40 days ago I arrived in India. After one month on mainland and the last week spent on Andamans Islands, today I had a flight from Port Blair to Kolkata and a connection flight from Kolkata to Bangkok.
Once arrived in Port Blair Airport, the employees told me that, not having an immigration office there, I had to take my backpack in Kolkata and check-in again.
Fine.

Arrived in Kolkata and collected my bag at 13.45, I move to SpiceJet desk for the Check-in the flight for Bangkok (SG43) scheduled for h15.45

After a long wait in queue, the guy at the desk (you can check the employees‚Äôname from my boarding pass issuing time) communicate me that if I would enter in Thailand, I should need to have and show them the Hotel reservation, Health insurance statement and a confirmed flight out of Thailand in one month.
I was pretty sure that having an Italian Passport, I didn‚Äôt need a VISA for Thailand (up to 45 days) and I tried to explain this to your desk-employee.
His answer was just: 
‚Äòeven for Italians is mandatory!‚Äô
I asked him several times if he was sure, but he was inamovable.

So I said ‚Äòok let‚Äôs check-me in and if I‚Äôll need, I‚Äôll buy a flight ticket at the Visa-office in Bangkok‚Äô 
No way, the clerk didn‚Äôt want to let me get the flight without the required documents.

At 14.45, with the plane leaving soon, I found my self in the senseless situation to buy an useless flight from Bangkok to Vientiane (that I would never use as I will continue my travel by land to Laos and then to Vietnam) just in order to take my plane for Bangkok!

A few hours ago I arrived in Suvarnabhumi Airport and at the Passport control gate, the girl simply told me ‚ÄòNo Sir, you don‚Äôt need anything. As per Italians citizens, you‚Äôve 45-days visa free‚Äô ‚Ä¶

after many emails, customer service continues to apologize for the delay of the flight‚Ä¶. no refund, no communication from management even in Cc. embarrassing non-management of the problem and indeed, general ignorance, beyond stupidity

Just a scam

title: Never again
text:
Thursday 26th January and we were booked to travel on board SpiceJet flight SG455 from Mumbai to Dabolim in Goa.

It was scheduled to depart at 15.05 and arriving at 16.30, an hour and twenty-five minute flight.

The departure time suited us as we we due to land in Mumbai, from Heathrow at 11.00 which gave us some leeway.

The day before our departure we received notification that due to operational difficulties our flight would not be departing until 18.30. At this point we were given the opportunity to request a refund or rebook another flight. 

We took the opportunity to book another flight, as it happens the flight due to depart at 11.15, SG 488, was delayed until 14.40. Later on during the day we received another notification  of a further delay until 15.15.

When we checked in at Mumbai, we were still scheduled to depart at 15.15, so all was looking good. However later on an additional delay was announced until 16.25 which was revised again to 16.05 and then 16.15.

Finally an aircraft turned up at 15.50 which we commenced boarding at 16.05 which was completed 16.30. The aircraft pushed back at 17.00 and was finally airborne at 17.20.

We were seated by the emergency exit, extra space seats. The extra cost of our seats included a chicken junglee or veg sandwich and a soft drink.

The captain did make a rather rambling announcement, don't know if it was an attempt at humour but it went over our heads. He made reference to the married men's club, flying carpets and regretted having to leave our ears to look after a trainee pilot. All very weird and at times not really appropriate. He did inform us that the flying time down to Goa would be 50 minutes. He also regretted any inconvenience caused by the delay.

The Crew did what they had to do, all a bit robotic. Must say that the cabin was clean. 

There was a child a few rows back that screamed virtually the entire flight adding to the misery of the experience.

We landed at 18.10 with a smack on brakes.

The name of the aircraft was Pri Pri, a reference to spice.
