title: Horrifying Experience. Not reliable airline for vacation planning
text:
We booked Spicejet for our return journey from Jodhpur to Bangalore on the 4th Nov 2021. As we had planned Jaisalmer trip for Diwali vacation, it was a good option to take 5.30pm flight back so that it gives us ample amount of time to travel from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur and 2hrs flight Journey. But we received an SMS at the airport just before boarding our onward flight to Jodhpur that the flight is cancelled. We are shocked and could not believe and we tried to reach the IVR. As you can expect, with 30mins on IVR we still could not reach anyone from spice jet customer care.

We had started looking for alternate flights for return and we were seeing double the fare and also longer duration of 7-10hr with stopovers. Our vacation had turned very unpleasant at the start itself thanks to Spice Jet.

So on landing at Jodhpur we headed to Spice jet ticket counter and started asking the reason for cancellation and demanded them to issue a return ticket for us. The front-end person was pretty much sticking to one sentence that "there is nothing he can do.." So we asked him to get the higher person and then came Mr Suryanarayan Murthy. He was giving us below 2 options 1. write a mail and get clarification and may be reimbursement. 2. Take the flight at 12pm from Jodhpur with stopover in Delhi and reach Bangalore midnight with 12hr layover.

We got really frustrated with the solutions he was giving us and with all heated argument we were telling him, we will not move until we get return tickets. But Mr Murthy later resorted saying you do not hold a chance as you have not read terms and conditions. I asked him "do you read terms-conditions while booking the flight?"and he promptly said" he reads"...I can only say such deceptive person can not serve people. 

Spicejet chose to cancel the flight as there were only 17 people who had booked. So bottomline is Spice jet is unreliable so you can book the flight and be ready to take the trauma if they cancel the flight for their so called operational reasons..On the contrary, Indigo flight on same day at 12.30pm took off with only 30-35 people on board. Which speaks for itself.

title: Worst airlines

I had international flight from Delhi and this showed me worst day of my life. üòì I am never going to travel from them for sure. 4 and half hours delay , are you kidding me??? I felt like local train..

title: Horrific experience
text:
On 31st Oct' 21, my son travelled from Dubai to Ahmedabad by SpiceJet Flight SG 717. His ticket had a scheduled departure at 02:00 from Terminal 1. Since he is quite young and not very used to of travelling alone, I had to accompany him up to the check-in procedure. We had planned to be at the Airport by 11:00 PM i.e. 3Hrs prior to the flight departure, as per the norms. But, since we had many bad experiences with Spice, due to the flight rescheduling & delays in the past, we tried checking the flight status before leaving for the Airport & were shocked to see the departure time as 00:30 Hrs. 
In a state of Panic, we rushed to the Airport to meet the preponed deadline, without my son even having his dinner. When we were almost there, we got a Text message from the Airline saying that your flight has been rescheduled and now it will be departing at 02:00 Hrs., which was the original time as per our Ticket.
Anyway, since we were already there, we proceeded towards the check-in counters only to witness a utterly chaotic scene. A complete mismanagement. No Spice staff was visible, only a few young boys from Dnata were desperately trying to manage the crowd. They had barricaded the entrance to the check-in area as hundreds of people, who believed the Flt. Time to be 00:30 Hrs., were already queued up in there for hours. For such a long que, only Three counters were operating, out of which one was Priority check-in only counter.
Outside the entrance, slowly instead of the length of the que, the number of queues started increasing and in no time, there were at least 7 ‚Äì 8 queues & no one knew which is the right one. The Dnata boys, in spite of their best efforts, were totally unable to control the situation & were on the verge of breaking up.
On a world class Airport like DXB T1, one could never expect or imagine a scene like Howrah Railway station. But SpiceJet successfully created it. Finally, after almost Three and a half nightmarish hours, my son could do with his check-in procedure and proceed for the departure gates.
I hope someone from the Senior management in Spice gets to read this and takes a note and some remedial action, so as to save the mental and physical harassment of so many passengers.

The spice girl (with no offense to them) who were darned with PPE seemed over their Red uniform..... They had a close resemblance of a Nurse... I not just go by  the appearance, but the kind enthusiastic spirit I would call them  Nightingales in Red uniform.

Am I justified to call them " Redhood Nightingales on sky"

Cheers

title: Amazing On-ground experience! Applaud-worthy crew
text: I boarded the flight from Surat to Jaipur on the 23rd of October '21. During my on-ground boarding, the luggage I packed was utterly hurried and the food items were packed in an oversized carton. The on-ground staff was so humble and kind to me that they help me out at their most! I want to thank, Ankita Tandel (121709), Mehul Surti, and Chetan Prakash for being super helpful and considerate. I was coming back to prepare for my UPSC and RAS exams, and these three people just won my heart by helping everyone out to their max. Spicejet has an amazing on ground crew. And I really want to applaud these three people! My name is Swatii Chandak. My seat number was 9C. Departure was at 9:05 (evening).

title: PARTHA GHOSH
text: Great service. All team members are doing excellent job. Thanks to all.They doing his / her best efforts. It's really appreciated to all. Good team work.

title: Supportive ground staff
text:
I and a colleague were travelling to Pune via Bengaluru from Jharsuguda. Our layover between 2 flights at Bengaluru was barely 40 mins. We requested ground staff at Jharsuguda to let us carry both out bags into cabin, as we would surely miss the connecting flight if we checked in our luggage.

The staff reluctantly but very graciously allowed us to proceed. This was exemplary approach by the staff and I thank the spice Jet check in team at Jharsuguda airport. All the best guys. You just helped me reach home without missing my flight in this festive season.

Cheers!

title: Worst Customer Service
text:
There was a mistake in my daughter's ticket and I am trying to contact the customer care from today morning. I was put on hold and waited for almost half an hour for the call to get connected. And at last when it got connected, they were acting like they were not able to hear me and said as there is no response from your side, I am disconnecting the call. My husband tried again. Again was put on hold for 25 minutes and at last when the call got connected, the same response.
This is so disappointing and frustrating. I am sure we dont have a network issue here they could hear us very well.  They were giving the same response to both of us.

my bad experience is only slow response on Call center.

title: Worst experience - No empathy for customers
text: I was travelling from Shiridi to Chennai alone. I was carrying baggage within the limits of 15 kg. But unfortunately I didn't have have a single bag, I had to put one little extra hand language for check in. But they insisted i pay 1000INR, else they wouldn't allow to board. In fact fellow passengers requested to allow. The fact that if you travel in groups you will allow 2 bags but if you travel alone you won't allow inspite of having below 15 kgs is atrocious. Spicejet could have very well made an exception case. It wasn't that everyone was putting their luggage for check in. If you want to extract money from customers without a logical reason, am lost for words. Please show some empathy to your customers. If you want to go by textbook rules, then please keep sending terms and conditions over email and text msg instead of advertisements. It was just one of a case, as such the weight was well within the limits. Finally i paid INR 1000. Regret travelling in that airline!

title: Worst airline
text:
This is the worst airline ever. All they want is your money by finding loopholes in the way customer carries luggage and then making them pay right before boarding. 
They will never weigh your cabin baggage at checkin, even if you are carrying less than the allowed limit. They will not bother about it as they have to carry less luggage, but when you carry even an 1 extra kilo they will make you pay for it. 

WHY NOT CHECK THE THE CABIN BAGGAGE WEIGHT AT THE TIME OF CHECKIN????? 
ONLY BECAUSE THEY RELY IN CUSTOMERS MAKING FAULT IN TERMS OF TOTAL ALLOWED WEIGHT IN CABIN AND THEN GET THAT HEAVY PER KG RATE RIGHT BEFORE BOARDING.

The in-flight crew were so accessible and ready to help. I was trying to pick my bag to put into the cabin - but the staff just asked me to relax and did all the needful. Ket asking if I needed any kind of assistance.  I'm glad I flew Spicejet. Will recommend friends to forget past experiences and fly the highly improved Spicejet. This experience was better than my Vistara experiences. Great Going Guys!! Keep it up

title: Hospitality above everything
text: The sweetest thing happened during my journey in the flight. I was craving some cup noodles and when I asked the flight attendant (whose name was Sakshi), she regrettably informed me that they were out them. A few minutes later, she returned  with a cup  of noodles which was supposed to be her meal and she didn't even charge me for it. I was so touched by this gesture, which made the noodles taste better tenfold. This shows that the staff values hospitality above everything else and that's very rare to see these days. They took care of every small needs of the passengers which is commendable. Looking forward to my next journey with SpiceJetüòÅ

title:
Never choosing this bad airlines again. 
It harasses their customers.
text:
I'm writing this review with utter frustration. My brother booked a ticket on SpiceJet on 6th September 2021 from Guwahati to Dehradun. It got delayed to 9th sep 2021. And the flight would have a 24 hours layover at Delhi or he had to take the flight the next day. He choose to fly on 10th.  He arrived airport at 10th September 2021, his flight was supposed to board at around 12:00 at noon. But, it again got delayed to 1:30pm and again to 3:00pm.
 Is this a joke?
Who gave you the rights to harass passengers like this. Seriously you need to turn down your operations.  SPICEJET. Shame on you.

title: Terrible refund experience... waiting for 18 months to get refund
text:
My flight got cancelled due to Covid-19 in 2019 and the airline created a credit shield for a year. Now after almost 2 years and 20 written communication the SpiceJet has the same feedback "

Message from SpiceJet on 12th March 2021: This is to inform you that if a customer is unable to use the available credit shell amount till 31st March 2021 then as per govt. guidelines the refund of credit shell amount will be initiated towards the mode of payment post 31st March 2021 only.

Message from SpiceJet on 21st March 2021: Please be informed that we have shared your details to the relevant team and the amount shall reflect in your account within 10 working days.

July 21: We have already initiated the refund request in above booking and the same is under process. The amount shall reflect into the given account at the earliest.

I believe that they are not willing to pay the refund. 

Horrible experience, all lies, no clarity and I guess no refund.

title: Appreciation of Cabin Crew.
text:
I had a spicejet flight from Jaipur to Ahmedabad - SG- 2984 on¬†29/08/2021.

I would like to praise the cabin crew staff on the above mentioned flight. She was so helpful and nature was so humble and friendly with all the passengers.

The name of the cabin crew is Ms. Angela, i was sitting all the way behind on my seat no. 19B and randomly, I noticed her because of her continous attentiveness and politeness towards all the pessengers, The humble way to insist passangers to wear there seat belts, masks and follow covid safety rules.

Not only her perfect way of working, but her dressing up of uniform, accessories,PPE kit and Mask were also perfectly put up.

Despite, the flight was completely packed up and having Just 2 crews, Her Continous prompt actions of serving to the passengers were so perfect, And by seeing her dedciation towards her work, got me to put up an appreciation mail for your team. Really team like these, make a far step further then travelling with any other reputated airlines.

Even the CCIC, Ms. Tarushka treated so well and served perfectly to all the pessengers.

Want to thank your entire team for making my journey so comfortable and safe during this pandemic.

I do regularly fly and will surely fly in my coming times with spice jet.

Best Regards,
Khubesh Punjabi,
(Managing Director)

title: The most pleasant journey in times of difficulty.
text:
I met with an accident last night which disabled me to walk and had my early morning flight today at 7. 

I was confused and anxious about what to do as I was in immense pain from the accident and was unable to walk.

But SpiceJet came to the rescue where I added the Wheelchair assurance addon in my ticket and it resulted in wonders for me.

I didn‚Äôt expect my case would be taken so much seriously. 

From the moment I entered Terminal 3 of Delhi airport I assisted by the ground staff and he passed me without any hassle through boarding and security check and dropped me to bus terminal, from there the flight attendees helped me to reach my seat and took care of my luggage.

I was specially taken care of where my needs and health was constantly being enquired by the flight attendees. 

Then the moment I landed in Guwahati, the attendees called up ground staff to bring the wheel chair up to the cabin and from assisting me from acquiring my luggage from conveyor belt to passing through COVID test and dropping me off to when my family arrived to receive me.

I overall was very much happy with the help and assistance provided and would recommend SpiceJet to my friends and family.

title: Ticket issued for non existent flight
text:
I booked a ticket for 17th of July for Mumbai from Dubai.  It was a medical emergency. The flight changed schedule humongously to 31st of July, and I came to know that the Spicejet flights were not operating on the route, in fact they don't have permission from the Indian Government. Under huge distress I had to book another ticket and cancel the Spicejet booking , of which 50% was cut and remaining 50% lay in Spicejet credit shell, which has validity only until 31st March 2022. Moreover it is of no use to me as flights are not operating on my regular route.

This is the biggest fraud I have been forced to endure and I advise everybody to be cautious when booking Spicejet, and double check. I have never felt more cheated. 

Why list your flight for booking if you have no permission to fly? And if it is your fault, why do we pay the huge penalty?

title: Terrible Experience with SpiceJet
text:
Terrible experience with SpiceJet. I booked tickets 2 times within 4 days to Travel from Jaipur to Pine, but both times flight got cancelled or diverting route with one or other excuses at last moment, when you have no other choices. 2 hour journey take 10 hours after rescheduling & purpose of visit collapsed, even needs to be cancelled return flight also.

title: Teaching English to Sardar Angrez! (Flight Steward)
text: I was on SG-341 (Kolkata to Guwahati) on Sunday Aug 8. I got the customary greeting of one of the Air Hostesses. But I was particularly impressed by the Flight Steward Sardar Angrez Singh! He gave a very clear and almost correct presentation to passengers with Emergency Exit. I was paying attention....and being a Professor of English in a Central University, currently Pro-Vice Chancellor, I couldn't resist complimenting him and also telling him that there is no word as 'Luggages' - LUGGAGE, BAGGAGE, WATER, MILK, etc. are both singular AND plural. He was open to my correction: a very uncommon quality! And we talked more, the flight being almost empty. Angrezji will go far wherever he serves. He has an open mind ready to sponge extra knowledge! My appreciation to the team of Angrez and the other 2-3 pretty and efficient ladies. I wish them well! I wish SpiceJet well! Prof. Sivasish Biswas/PVC, Assam University, Diphu Campus.

title: Never Again
text:
I had a flight from Bengaluru to Ahmedabad today scheduled to depart at 5:30 in the evening.Yesterday Spicejet sent a message saying that the timing has been revised to 06:00.I thought it's fine as flight is just postponed by 30 minutes and that will not impact my schedule. Today I reached Bengaluru airport and a surprise was waiting for me. Spicejet executive  told me that my flight left at 6:00 AM in the morning.

I had never heard of any flight being preponed by 12 hours ever in my life.When later I started thinking about this I realized what did Spicejet do. They cancelled the evening flight and transferred the evening passengers to their regular morning flight probably due to low occupancy.Instead of cancellation they called it revising the schedule. 

This was very unethical and on top of that their executives were very rude and trying to put the blame on passengers.
Anyways I have decided to never travel with them again even if I need to pay more for other flights.Thhis was the second time I had a terrible experience with them and it's time to say goodbye to them.

title: NOT TO BE TRUSTED
text: One can neither trust them with being on time nor with even the day it‚Äôs scheduled to fly.  My flight got rescheduled thrice that too by one day forward every time. Too add to the frustration, the super long layover did not even allow a smooth transfer. I have to wait for the counters to open for four hrs post which I will have my flight. Not to mention that  once the connection was delayed by an hr too. Feeling too annoyed at the moment to imagine what the next connection has to bring.

text:

title: Worst service, never think about spicejet in your dreams. Didn't get the refund yet.
text:
There was no other option but writing this review about the experience with spicejet. I rarely write reviews but I strongly feel my booking with Spicejet should serve as a warning to all passengers who are thinking of travelling with them.

I had a booking with Spicejet on 25th March 2020 (ignore the July 2020 as it was the earliest option I could choose) but the airline cancelled the flight due to Covid. Spicejet has claimed that they would refund me for the tickets as it was cancelled twice and further I didn't travel.

16 months later, I have yet to receive the full refund. On several occasions, Spicejet has claimed the refund would be paid within days, and when no refund is found in my account, they claim a 'technical glitch' is the cause.

After many mails and calls they have refunded only INR 2419 instead of INR 7019. Even they are not responding the mails for months. I have already paid INR 800 as convenience fee which is non refundable.

I have filed grievance claims, and may have to resort to suing Spicejet, as it seems our refund will be forever 'under process' (Spicejet's phrase which probably means nothing is being done).
I hope this review will publicly shame Spicejet into paying my full refund (and probably many other passengers). After all, the Supreme Court of India ruled that Spicejet should pay its refund by 31st March 2021, so Spicejet is in violation of this.

title: Beware flying with Spicejet: endless refund claim
text:
I rarely write reviews but I strongly feel my booking with Spicejet should serve as a warning to all passengers who are thinking of travelling with them.
We had a booking with Spicejet on 21st March 2000 (ignore the July 2020 as it was the earliest option I could choose) but the airline cancelled the flight due to Covid. Spicejet has claimed that they would refund us for the tickets. 
15 months later, we have yet to receive the refund. On several occasions, Spicejet has claimed the refund would be paid within days, and when no refund is found in our account, they claim a 'technical glitch' is the cause.
We have filed grievance claims, and may have to resort to suing Spicejet, as it seems our refund will be forever 'under process' (Spicejet's phrase which probably means nothing is being done).
I hope this review will publicly shame Spicejet into paying my refund (and probably many other passengers) but I am not so sure. After all, the Supreme Court of India ruled that Spicejet should pay its refund by 31st March 2021, so Spicejet is in violation of this.

title: Fraud Airlines
text:
If you are planning to fly to Dubai I suggest avoid Spicejet. I booked ticket on 24 Apr from PNQ-AHM-DXB paying 50K INR as that was the only flight which was able to land before travel ban announced by UAE.
Same day another flight from PNQ-Delhi-DXB was there charging 18K INR but was not landing before travel ban hence I went for 50K Pune- Ahmedabad-Dubai.
I got sms at 8:30PM that tomorrows flight got reschedule to mooring 8:30 AM which will go to Delhi.
Now SpiceJet don't have single reason why they changed my flight which is not going to land in Dubai.
No response from customer care, I went to Delhi and found that crew is clue less and they told me Ahmedabad flight also got cancelled.
You can take other flight complete refund will be done. I tool Indigo flight paying 62K at Delhi.
Later I come to know that Ahmadabad flight never got cancelled but they were selling tickets at higher rates hence they moved me to morning flight which was definitely going to cancel.
Now I am dropping mails calling them no response at all. I am waiting for one more week or ease will talk to my lawyer and will file a case in consumer court.
I suggest never trust these guys.

title: Smooth Journey

title: unprofessional and arrogant ground staff
text:
I have travelled through SG141 on 26th Apr. Their ground staff is very unprofessional and arrogant. I have observed that hand baggage weight limit policy of 7kg is applied to only certain customers. I have been waiting in the que for boarding and in front of me many customers gone with higher weight and in my turn I had 2 kg extra and I have been instructed to pay 60Dhs per kg for excess weight. I completely honour their terms and conditions but my question is that the policy should be uniform to all customers. I don‚Äôt understand the logic behind different terms according to the face value of customers. They are favouring some customers according to their wish and relaxed for more than 10kg. When I tried to ask this to their ground staff, they were so arrogant and impatient. They kicked me out from the que and rudely told if you don‚Äôt want to pay throw your item. I have been travelling in this sector for past 17 years and used many carriers. Never experienced such behavior earlier.
When I entered the flight, again surprising that there is no space to keep my hand baggage in rack. They have collected such a heavy amount and I had to keep that items below my seat compromising leg space.I didn‚Äôt see any kind of customer service training in their team. When I shared my experience to their customer service team later, they come up with copy paste of standard reply format justifying their terms. Be aware about their standard so that you will not have disappointment.

title: THE MOST INCONVENIENT AIRLINE EVER
text:
WORST AIRLINE TO TRAVEL IN!

Do yourself a favor, save your money and time! Pay a few extra bucks and make your life easier. These people are completely unprofessional and WAY TOO rude to the customers. 

I was flying from Dharamshala to Delhi today. Had a same day flight back! There wasnt any flight scheduled back to Delhi for today after this one.

So, my flight was scheduled to depart at 1.45! Boarding time was 1.15. Dharamshala airport is small like a private airport, so it‚Äôs in and out. 

I couldn‚Äôt do a web check-in because their website was messing up. Either way, I thought I‚Äôll just grab a boarding pass from the airport kiosk and head to security because I only had my laptop bag with me and NO CHECK IN LUGGAGE. 

I got to the airport at 1.10pm because of unexpected traffic in Dharamshala. Again, boarding time was 1.15pm. 

BUT, here‚Äôs the catch! THE FLIGHT WAS LEAVING THE GATE AT 1.10 which is 35 minutes before the departure time! I was on a business trip where the schedule was tight. They can‚Äôt do this as per their convenience. 

I was so surprised because I didn‚Äôt get any communication from them, neither did my travel agent receive any form of communication. 

All I had to do was get a boarding pass, head to security and walk to the aircraft. It would‚Äôve taken 10-15 mins at the Dharamshala airport. I could see spicejets employee behind the counter, NOT CLOSED but since the flight was pushing backkkk from the gate AT SPICEJETS CONVENIENCE, so they reported me as a NO SHOW. PUSHING BACK EARLY WHEN EVERYBODYS BOARDED SEEMS REASONABLE! How can you push back without all your passengers there? It‚Äôs not like it was informed two three days before that the timings are changing or I would‚Äôve canceled the whole flight and changed plans because those timings didn‚Äôt work for my trip. 

STOP STEALING FROM THE CUSTOMERS! I want my money back or redeemed for a future flight because this is no professionalism. 

I was mistaken to have not checked in online, I accepted that to them. But, the website was giving me so much trouble. Even then, it wouldn‚Äôt have mattered because a gentlemen who had checked in online was also denied to board at 1.10. AND HIS BOARDING PASS SAID BOARDING AT 1.15. - in total 4 people missed their flights because of this crap. 
#spicejet
#spicejetairlines
#SpicejetIsAwful
#banspicejet because this is a regular  complain with this damn airline. I have had similar experiences before and this is probably the last time I‚Äôll be flying with them. 

THERE WAS A MAN WHO DIDNT GET TO BOARD WITH ME AND HE KEPT CRYING AND REQUESTING TO BOARD BECAUSE THERE WAS SOMEONE SICK IN THEIR FAMILY. HE WASNT VERY WELL OFF EITHER THAT HE COULD AFFORD TO BUY ANOTHER PLANE TICKET. 

DISGRACEFUL AND UNCORTEOUS.

Please avoid travelling by Sprice Jet in times of COVID.

title: Happy customer
text: I had a flight yesterday from Delhi to Dubai ie on 4th of April 2021, I was overwhelmed as I was treated so good by the cabin crews. I was flying by SG 154, Unfortunately I left my laptop on the waiting area which I realised after boarding the flight just before the take off.  Immediately I informed to the cabin crew Ms. Ankita Karki, she without wasting single minute sent another cabin crew to get my laptop bag I had left in the waiting area, which later I received in a proper manner. They even asked me if I am comfortable in my seat as I was in the second last row from the back and offered if I want to seat in front as there were seat available. I am so happy I got my laptop and also got very good service both on board and on the ground. I would recommend and would love to travel with spicejet again and again. Though I am a frequent flyer of it already.

title: Amazing Customer service
text:
I, Mr. Satish Villait, flew from BOM to CCU under the PNR - ECDYGG. Flight no - SG370.
This is to express my sincere gratitude and appreciation for the wonderful ground staff that they have at the Kolkata airport. I want to specifically mention about the gentleman in the check-in counter that dealt with us. Mr. Gautam, was reflecting an extraordinary degree of customer care. Not just Gautam but also the female staffs assisting him for our query, they were modeling the behaviour of serving the guests to all ends in its best form. Due to the ongoing covid situation and covid tests, we had to wait back and rebook our flight from CCU to IXR which made us agitated and restless but on the contrary Mr. Gautam assisted us by being most polite and calm, he didn't express any discomfort or uneasiness in tackling the situation. And also promised us partial refund which was going out of his way to help us with the situation.  What was striking me hard was his gentle composure and smooth shift of communication skill, without any sense of counter transference that could generally arise due to an apathetic customer. They have definitely done a very good job in nurturing and grooming such staff, for which I congratulate them. I am looking forward to my next Spice Jet flight, not only for a flying experience of my money's worth but also for the delight that their staff could make us experience by their behaviour par excellence. 

I wish them all the very best.

title: Spicejet SG-453
text:
I was traveling first time after lockdown.
Before journey; I was little nervous & scared about the safety measures & discomfort caused due to those safety measures.
But, to my surprise!!, at SpiceJet, the ground staff & the crew members made it a wonderful experience, that too way better than it was before the pandemic.

In few words they were more concerned about our safety than we ourselves can possibly be.

I can happily say that I met few amazing crew members serving in this hospitality field;
The MAGNIFICENT NANDITA (spreading positivity in pandemic simply by assisting us by smiling her heart out, her dazzling, sparkling eyes made us forget about the pandemic) and the KIND JHANVI (polite and very prompt at everyone's request) these two gorgeous ladies helps us experiencing a very smooth and ease journey.The way they are handling the passengers was delightful to experience.

Not to forget the food was also tastier, healthier than earlier it use to be; Really Delicious.

For me, it's definitely by far the best journey.

text:
I actually gave them a good review whilst I was flying. I must say it's quite a mystery how things got stolen off my checkin bag. 
I made a report as soon as I reached Home to the customer service, and they made absolute no effort on investigating as to what happened. 
They just replied back to me saying sorry they couldn't find it. 
I even put my PNR number up there so the spicejet people should know who it is. 
I actually gave them a good review and I regret it. 
It annoyed me so much that in the future I will pay more money and travel with another airline. But never again with Spicejet nor I would recommend anyone else to use it.

title: Good Experience

title: Love you SpiceJet!
text:
SG198 BLR-DEL :
I reached BLR Airport early and checked in by myself at the self checkin counter at the airport the agent assisting at the self checkin kiosk was really really friendly and assisting every single passenger depending on their own needs, after spending a few hours at the airport it was time for me to board VT-SYR operating as SG198, the aircraft was extremely clean! I used alcohol based wet wipes to wipe my tray table even though it was sanitized and clean before i boarded, and after i was done wiping it i could not see a thing on the wet wipes cloth which i used! coming to the service, I was left with no words! i prebooked my food and the first thing i noticed was the value for money! Other low cost airlines charge their passengers 200 for a sad, cold sandwich where'as i was getting a full meal for that same price! That made a really really good value for money also back in Nov 2019 i flew with an airline in India which was rated as 5 stars recently and as i began eating that traw i could finish it as soon as the cabin crew reached 2 rows behind me but here that was not the case, At SpiceJet i asked for a small amount of something and was given a handful! That really felt awesome also to mention that the crew who served me chicken schezwan first called the passengers by their name, same was the case for me but i was sitting at my seat doing something else and the crew waiting holding it, waiting for me to finish doing my whatever i was doing! such a great gesture because the other,"blue" airlines in India who serve just sandwiches don't even be professional, just take the money and throw the sandwich sort of a thing kind of attitude is what they have. But at SpiceJet that's miles apart from those,"blue" airlines and that is what makes a remarkable difference in my point of view!! Then the cabin light's where dimmed after the clearance was done, That's just the small details which matters the most in such cases like the cabin's interior light had mood lighting equipped which was red in color and the aircraft had SpiceScreen, The quality of announcements by the cabin crew and Captain Rahul Sharma along with his First Officer Aman Bhatia - Their quality of airmanship truly can not be met anywhere else in the entirety of the 737 fleet there is in India across ANY airline! The entire set of Cabin Crew, Tarannum, Zeenat, Tashi and Arpana where extremely active all throughout the cabin! If by any chance a passenger wouldn't be feeling that good in the flight, SpiceScreen was there to help that passenger stay happy and high in passenger comfort, how can i mention how well was i treated! probably the best flight i've ever had in 2020! Truly the best hands down! There are good experiences and then there are good experiences that change your experience into an emotion, the fact that I'm writing such a long and comprehensive feedback actually proves it, also before and after booking my flight with SpiceJet i was continuously looking at the reviews on tripadvisor and undoubtedly all reviews had 5 stars! That's understandable why from the baggage drop till the deboarding, every single thing was super awesome and taken care of specially the experience at the baggage belt arrival, his name was Mr. Manish Kumar! wearing a red colored SpiceJet t shirt (Not the first time I've appreciated SpiceJet's Delhi based employees) really well mannered and well trained, definitely says why SpiceJet deserves 4 stars (highest any Low Cost Airline has gotten) all left alone, I'll hands down give SpiceJet 5 stars! without a doubt there's a saying that if you do someone good then they'll remember it for more than 5 years or for years to come even if it's been really long and SpiceJet has proved it! Also a special mention to Mr. Aamir Bhat who wasn't on my flight but tried the best he could in his power to help also to the boarding staff at the gate (gate 17) I'll probably never even have such an awesome experience with any other,"blue low cost airline" thanks to all proverbly my words can't express into emotion on the level of service i've received. Will hands down take SpiceJet over ANY overrated low cost/full service airline in the future if there's any airline capable of 5 stars, it's SpiceJet! Special thanks to everyone specially- Captain Rahul Sharma, First Officer Aman Bhatia and cabin crew Tarannum, Zeenat, Tashi, Arpana!

title: Corporate flyers avoid SpiceJet!
text:
I‚Äôma veteran business traveler and travel with my usual cabin bag and laptop bag. I‚Äôve never been stopped but today SpiceJet check in staff refused to allow me to carry this saying my bag is 2 kg excess! He insisted I check in my bag despite my telling him that I have to travel further in kolkata late night after a long work day. They just stuck to their silly rules showing no concern to me. Sure enough, the flt left 1 hr late, luggage arrived 50 mins after landing. Effectively ruined my night. 
My advice: fly any other airline except SpiceJet.

title: Unprofessional, under-trained & unethical staff/airlines
text:
1. The flight delayed by almost 5 hours without any proper information from the airlines/staff.

2. Once we boarded the flight, there was already an elderly couple at our seats who had the same seat numbers mentioned in their boarding pass as well. When we informed the ground staff, they blatantly refused it was a computer error/human error (how illiterate of them) and asked us to seat in different places which where we were poles apart from each other. They even threatened to de-board us when we complained stating we were causing the delay of the flight (when the flight was already delayed for 5 hours).

3. At the BLR airport, the airhostess announced that the luggage can be collected from conveyor belt# 7. Since, I've been a frequent traveler via BLR airport, I was well aware that there are only 6 belts. When politely requested the airhostess to reconfirm stating the obvious, she rudely answered - "Sir, our staff knows the airports better; please do as you're advised or else you can sort your own issues with the airport authority!" (Wowww)

In short, even if I've to pay a few bucks more, I shall opt for Air India, Air Asia, Vistara or Indigo, and even Go Air. But Spicejet, a stricy NO NO!

title: Excellent SpiceJet Cabin Crew!
text:
One of the best experience with today‚Äôs Spicejet #cabincrew specially Gaurav, Erykah, Varsha, Vinodinhi and Tanya. There small gestures, at the start of my day, made me more energetic and positive. Even though couldn‚Äôt see there smile due to mask, but their body language said everything.
¬†The best part with I enjoyed was when they announced my name in flight (cause I was not sitting on my seat) while I was sleeping, for serving me breakfast. This is something which I have never experienced before.

To the entire @spicejetairlines Team, I wish you all the very best in future, wish all your dreams and goals come true and make india proud of being the best country in the world to live in.

title: Excellent flight and service.
text:
Flying from a Tier 3 airport in India has its own merits and scope of improvement. We took the SpiceJet Flight 507 to DEL and had a great experience. 

We thoroughly enjoyed the service of the cabin crew Mr. Sayed and Ms. Ankita and found them to be on top of their game WRT courtesy, competency and responsiveness. They are SpiceJet stars and in my view, they should be recognised for displaying warmth, hospitality and safety creating differentiation. 

Also, while it's great that GoI is connecting more and more smaller towns to metro cities, I do hope with so much of engineering expertise and resources in the country, we should construct world class sustainable airports from Day ONE and not small railway stations on steroids in the name of an airport. going forward, make airports paperless, automated baggage scanners, better facilities, aero bridges, etc. Come on,  That's the only way our airports can be future proof and truly incredible.

Thank you Spice Jet for a differentiated wonderful experience. Cheers.

title: Feedback for Pooja Saysar : - Wish you luck for your career
text:
I have taken a flight SG8937 on 1st February Pune to Delhi. Everything was very good. The meal was very good and warm. What made it more cheerful was a girl coming to me and asking me about the comfort. She had very preety smile and was very generous to all the customers. title: Disappointed
text:
Never expected such type of customer service upon check in at counter. Lady Safzia was beautiful in looks but she sounds so irritated and frustrated which we can clearly realize while dealing with customers at counter. 

We have requested one wheel chair while booking tickets, though she had allotted all 4 of us in different location I wonder even she had lost her common sense. At least one of us should be there to accompany the person who is on wheel chair.

Hostess on flight with untie hair walking in flight with half worn shoes looks so unprofessional.

1 person 1 luggage policy is really inconvenient. 

However, flight was on time and flight reached the destination in less time than other flights which I used to travel. And I really appreciate the courtesy of person who took my mother in wheel chair.

I told this to the lead cabin attendant as I stepped off the aircraft. He could have done something but chose not to. He just gave a look as if he was amazed.
Poor show, Spicejet. 
We did not ask for it, but if you did announce it, you should deliver.

title: Is It Too Early to Move On
text:
On 19jan 2021 I was flying to jammu from Delhi by the splice jet flight. It was a foggy morning ( not unknown to us Delhites) and the all flights could not take off before 830am..
The GMR administrator and the airline staff could not manage the sudden rush and swarms of people assembled near boarding gates 42 and 44 a,d . What was frightening that sanitization, social distancing seemed to have been kept away in the shelves.it could get fatal if we mismanage now.
And biggest irony was wearing the face shields and boarding. 
Service inside was top notch but the whole process at Delhi Airport was surprising and unacceptable..

text: I traveled in SpiceJet from Dubai to kolkata with PNR - R79BJY recently. It was worst experience with them they are just forced to loot money from passengers. As I have a Tv with 49 inches and no other language they have charged 250 AED as a handling charges and over sized charges extra. The money is more than half of the ticket value And it was horrible experience. But still I was I was ok and moved on. And before boarding into the flight there is a weight machine placed and everyone needs to go through it and the people who are in charge of that process was very rude and no manners towards elders I have observed their behaviour and they have asked people to pay 70 AED for one kg. Which is very mean and treating passengers like a labour class and treating passengers.Staff in Dubai was not at all supportive and made my travel experience worst. Mine was 7.8 kg and they have demanded me to pay 70 AED. It‚Äôs fine having 1 or 2 kg extra. They are people with 4 or 5 kg they have charged equals to their itinerary fare. DONT FLY WITH SPICEJET FOR BETTER TRAVEL EXPERIENCE. WORST AND CHEAP CLASS EMPLOYEES.

title: Pathetic Service from Spicejet for carrying infant and also ticket is not rescheduled
text: I have booked 2 tickets from Mumbai to Patna. I have reached late at counter. They were checking our luggage and came to know that we have infant with us for whom we have not booked ticket. We have requested them for letting us go with charges to be paid for infant as my monther in law was serious but no positive reply from Spicejet ground staff.Also now we have not got any alterations for flight nor any amount is refunded. This is just worst experience for me and decided not to go with spice Jet in future.

title: Spicejet are Worst Airline and non cooperative
text:
I started my journey from Saudi Arabia and I had a GoAir ticket. Due to travel restriction choice of Airlines are limited. When my luggage was weighed at Saudi it was 11.5 kg. 
Flight landed at New Delhi Airport from where I had a connecting flight to Dehradun. The next flight I booked was of Spicejet and from Duty Free I purchased 2 alcohol bottles. At the Spicejet ticket counter I was asked to put the 2 alcohol bottles each of 1 ltr into the luggage as it is not allowed to carry them via Immigration. 
Later when the luggage was weighed it showed 20.5 kgs. Which was surprising for me. Seems there is something fishy in their weighing scale. 
I am a Merchant Navy Captain and aviation industry has to give special preference to Merchant Navy personnel as both industries are interlinked. Also Merchant Navy crew are frequent flier. The Counter female clearly refused for any consideration,then I asked her superior and she too behaved in a very arrogant manner. For me I definitely can pay for extra luggage but it was an insult to my rank and my profession. 
For sure any crew flight ticket arrangement in future will not be arranged by Spicejet by me. I don't want my fellow crew members to face the same humiliation I faced. 

Thanks

title: Worst possible Experience.
text: The worst possible experience I've had on a flight with spicejet. I was travelling on 6th Jan 2021. We flew to kerala and then were brought back to Mumbai international Airport saying technical issues. We had to wait for 2 hours in the flight and then they told us that we have to change the flight. I got a message from the company with the updated time which was after 1 hour. Then we went for boarding but then they did not communicate with the frisking team and were asked to wait. Then they told us that we have our flight after 2 hours and took us to another gate. No transparency and nothing. Mo information is been conveyed properly. Worst experience ever. Won't travel again for this airline.

title: Angels in the air
text: I have had an experience that cannot be second. Such warm and amazing staff and air hostesses. From the time I boarded the plane to my landing, they kept coming to ask if i needed any assistance. I have acute reumatoid arthritis with severe swelling n pain which becomes severe with cold temperatures. And once the plane landed as and i was down waiting in the wheel chair for my turn to come to be taken further , this sweet angel hostess comes to me and checks on if am was ok , then since i had not eaten , she asked me if i was hungry , n last but not the least she saw me clinging to my shawal so she ran up the stairs to get me a hot bottle of water to keep myself warm. WOW WOW WOW. who does so much for anyone.. only some1 my own would do.... But this girl took my heart away.. god bless her and yr entire force for such n incredible experience. Sorry i dont knw her name.

title: Rude behavior from Spicejet Captain!!!!
text: Comments	I was travelling with my family Dammam - Calicut on 10 Dec 2020 by flight number SG9918 and we really enjoyed the trip during the full trip including the check in. However we would like to draw your attention to one of the bad incident from your employee. Our seats were 3A and 3B and entered the flight almost at the end of the boarding process. We were trying to accommodate our hand baggage within the available space within the overhead compartment. In between one person occupying seat 1F started shouting us not to touch his bags!!! We were thinking that it is a crazy passenger but later on found from the crew that it is the captain of Spicejet!!!! It was a shocking moment and we have never came across such an arrogant airline staff, whether national OR international carrier. We are not able to understand how can spicejet afford such a bad person as your captain especially during this COVID season. We tried to complain to the crew but it was of no use since the captain is above all of them. We request your office to have an investigation to this incident and let us know the corrective actions from your side. We had the videos and photos of this person and were planning to put it on social media and travel forums but decided to look for your opinion before such acts. We are ready to provide any further information required by you to complete the investigation process and we are eagerly waiting for your action plans. We do not want such an experience to any passenger any time hence an urgent support and action plan from Spicejet team will be highly appreciated.

title: The worst Airline support.

title: Made me just a bit nervous

title: Worst travel ever
text: Worst experience ever! I was travelling from dubai to india alone with my one year old daughter. Since I was alone, i was planning to checkin her stroller and the 7kg cabin baggage so that I can walk freely with my daughter. So I got the stroller wrapped(which costs about 30aed) and went to the counter. The lady at the counter was very rude to me and asked me to pay for checking them in or to open my stroller and take the 7kg hand luggage of mine and 7kg hand luggage of my daughter with me. How can someone be so merciless? I have been in many airlines and never have I experienced such appalling behavior. So I had to carry them and my daughter was in a bad mood that day. She didn't want to sit on the stroller. So i had to carry her and push the stroller as well. By the time i reached the plane I was exhausted. I had a back ache and my baby was tired too. I had to ask others to help me fold my stroller up, put the bags up and finally when I sat down i realised that the food is paid only. No conplimentaries. Why did I even pay for my infant if there is no seat, no food or no baggage allowance for her. How am I supposed to carry her luggage and mine with the stroller. The flight got delayed and by the time we landed i was  really tired and hungry. And guess what! I got the stroller after all my suitcases were received.  So i had to wait for a long time to get it. So what was the point in making me suffer if it all went to the same area of the plane. Worst nightmare. I am never travelling in spicejet ever!

title: Terrible Experience with SpiceJet

Adding to the above problem we had to collect our baggage at Delhi Airport and do check-in for Chennai....Reason stated to me at the Srinagar airport for not transferring the baggage directly is... your connecting flight from Delhi is next day, i was shocked to hear that.....Worst ever experience

title: Insensitive, inhumane airline with pathetic customer service
text:
And I thought Indigo policy of not allowing kids on certain rows was anti-family till I met SpiceJet. 

Today my family is travelling to Patna from Bengaluru. The party includes a mother, a normal 6-year-old, and a special needs 8 years old. I diligently pre-selected seats because my special needs child has sensory issues and finds it difficult to travel at the end of the airplane.

At the very last moment after my family boarded the flight Spicejet decided not to respect the pre-paid seats, and split a party fo 2 less than 8 years old kid and a mother to the opposite end of the airplane ( row 4 and row 23) 

The customer service is unreachable. They are highly unmanned and use a chatbot. The customer service will show an average contact time of half an hour. 

The SM customer service is merely platitude like accept our apology that we don't mean, and then contact us separately to get a resolution.

What is the meaning of charging people for seat selection when you can choose to not respect them at any time? How do you accept a party of a mother and 6 and 8 yr old child to travel by sitting at polar opposite ends of aircraft? 

Inhuman, insensitive, nincompoop, pathetic airlines is Spicejet

title: Unwilling to accept responsibility
text: SpiceJet messaged me on 15th October saying that our 18th November flight from Mumai to Kochi on SG282 at 15:50 was now flight SG 476 departing at 20:30. They referred to this as a "rescheduling". To my mind this was a late cancellation of SG 282, which created an unacceptable delay to our plans. SpiceJet had even sent us electronic boarding passes for SG 282. I then discovered SpiceJet had changed the flight again, without telling me, to SG 316 departing Mumbai at 18:45. Email exchanges with Customer Experience were useless, they wouldn't accept that SpiceJet had cancelled our original flight and said I had to phone the 24/7 Reservations Helpline "for security reasons". After four attempts I got through at 03:30 (Indian time). Again, no acceptance that SpiceJet had cancelled SG 282, all I could do was cancel SG 476/SG 316 (and a connecting flight) as the flight times were no use to us, and pay cancellation fees. Really poor customer service from SpiceJet - and it cost the Sterling equivalent of INR 2,200 in phone bills from the UK. Not impressed. If SpiceJet is interested, the PNR was PEF2GQ .

title: Amazing Service, AWESOME CARE BY Flight Crew
text:
Dear Concern,

This is to bring it to your notice that this about my Travel on 23rd October 2020 on Flight No. SG 516, KOL-BLR, PNR JC9ZNW. Please find the attached ticket for your reference. 

This is about the exceptional quality and services your airline brings a lot of joy to our lives.

Since Travel is extremely risky and Spicejet has just made me feel safe only because of two things, The care from the AWESOME CREW and Hygiene from the aircraft Maintenance. 

It was an early morning flight and during Navratri in Kolkata, I was exhausted and very much irritated when I had entered the flight itself. I was greeted by a wonderful smile and warm welcome by Ms. Dhanya Devasia, The first thing she asked me was Sir, If you don‚Äôt mind can I offer you some water. You look very tired. It relieved my Pain and They say the first impression or First thing in Hospitality about how do you approach someone. 

This is not the first time I have flown with SG. SG is my domestic travel partner and as always I have seen much crew on many flights back and forth.

I think there is an appreciation day for everything so I‚Äôm sure there is a Flight Attendant Appreciation Day¬†‚Äî but I think¬†that should be every single time you get on a plane. 

Treating people good and making them comfortable even when they don‚Äôt matter to you is something you don‚Äôt find in anybody. 

Honestly, If I am writing such a long post indicates how happy I was during my journey. 

Flight attendants are not there to make your drinks, serve your food, and wait for hand and foot on you. 
Their #1 reason for existing and being on your flight is to¬†keep you safe. Period. 

I informed Ms. Dhanya Devasia About my issue with Sinus, and how my ears create horrible pain. I can write and give it to you, Every 5 Mints Ms. Dhanya Devasia Herself or Ms. Aishwarya Bagewadi coming to me and giving me hot water to sip, taught me some jaw exercise by Dhanya Devasia.

Everything else is a perk. All-day long, these men and women put up with rude people, people who don‚Äôt listen to instructions, people who actually physically abuse them, and so much more. 

I have Attached two gift cards for these two beautiful and amazing souls. I hope this reaches them. It's a token of gratitude for taking care of me on the course of the flight.

Once Again Mr. Dhanya Devasia Amazing Job. You make Spicejet Proud. I am Proud to Travel on Spicejet.

People Make Organisations and I am sure you have the right people for it. Good Work Spicejet. Keep It Up.

title: Concern regarding seat selection

title: Humanitarian spiceness!!
text: This is regarding my latest flight SG 942 to Delhi from Jaisalmer on the 29th of October 2020. I was travelling back from my honeymoon with my wife and she couldn't have anything for food when we checked out of our hotel due to some issue she had. When we arrived at the airport, we hadn't expected that there would not be any outlet to even have snacks. We were really stranded at the airport for a good 5 hours and my wife had a real tough time negotiating the over fasting that she was carrying over from the past night. When we boarded the flight, I requested onboard cabin crew, Ms Anupriya to help me with some eatable for my wife (I explained the situation to her).  She politely affirmed and asked me to wait for some time as in these covid times, there are no meals for sale, if there is no pre booked meal on board. She then discussed the matter with Mr Kush, her senior and they both assured that they would be helping us in the condition. Within no time, we were given eatables and beverages not only for my wife, but for both of us. I was so touched by this gesture that I didn't have words enough to thank both the cabin crew members. These gestures in times of need restore faith in humanity and help highlight the team that works for respective organisations. I congratulate Spice Jet for having such customer centric and empathetic team members!

title: Mishandled Baggage
text:
I boarded a flight of spicejet from Bangalore to gwalior on 29th aug.

Flight :- SG 3325
PNR:- S8Z5TI

I checked in at 8:45 A.M where departure time is 9:50 A.M.

Spice-jet Team scanned and checked our bag in Bangalore and took our bag for boarding.A power bank is there our check-in bag but they didn't check and scanned properly which we forget to take out from that check-in bag.

We boarded the flight on last moment one of crew member gave that detail to some other lady that this is the authority letter you have to sign where we found power bank on your bag and we can't board that bag it will come on next day on next flight that lady denied and said my bag doesn't have power bank.
On last moment he searched me and came to me saying please sign this authority letter power bank is there on your bag ,he said please sign this as we cannot take power bank and it will come tomorrow, I asked power bank you will take out from my bag? And forward my bag? Suddenly one air-hostess  came and took that paper from him and she told yes mam we found power bank they will wrap that power bank and send it on next day and bag we are forwarding now only after taking it out.i said "ok" we forget that power bank it's our mistake ,only 5 mins left for flight to start they asked me to sign soon, without reading and trusting on that air-hostess  I signed that paper.

As soon as I landed Gwalior I got a call from spice-jet that your bag is at Bangalore airport ask someone to take it and you signed that authority letter.

I was in shock my all stuffs including original documents, my money, everything is there on my bag and its not handled properly.my heart was on my mouth.

I literally scared and told him what are you talking nobody is there in Bangalore who will take my bag and I need my bag now he said we will send it on tomorrow's flight only.

I am girl from Chhatarpur (m.p) to reach my native place on this pandemic from Bangalore.I took Bangalore-Gwalior spice-jet flight and post reaching to Gwalior I took my personal cab to reach to my native which is 250 km from Gwalior.

As I doesn't belong to Gwalior  who will come next day to Gwalior airport to take my bag as nobody is here in Gwalior ,I discussed it with Gwalior spice-jet people over there named Vishnu and Sushmita ,we had a 2hrs of discussion. They took our native address and said we will try to send.

It's been 5days I didn't receive my bag they are saying it's on Gwalior airport we are not able to find vendor .we found one vendor he is asking 3 thousand rupees if you pay we will send and it's not our responsibility.That too they are saying after two days.

On this pandemic situation they want a girl to come again 250 km to take her bag again on airport because of their mistake .
Such inhuman behavior I have seen.

I am sleepless ,worried, concerned not able to sit on this anxiety. 

I am really want my bag back and I want my power bank also.
I thought leave the power bank but now i want everything back as you dont  deserve even 1 rupee of mine for this irresponsible and inhumane behavior.

I am really frustrated and I will not leave spice-jet at all and I will take social media help  to get it resolved. 

Below is the compliant raised number and all details

PNR:S8Z5TI
Flight/Date: SG3325/29 AUG
Number of Mishandled Bag(s): 1
Bag 1
Tag No:0775191687
Color type:BN22HWX

But no response till yet i am only receiving mails saying, we tried to call you but you are not reachable.

I am receiving thousands of call except spice-jet.

Your unsatisfied/frustrate/victim customer

Deeksha Gupta
7411618389
deeksha.g92@gmail.com

To add insult to injury, a ‚Äûcustomer experience‚Äú person from SpiceJet responds to these posts, asking complaining reviewers to contact the airline to get things straight. This leaves the impression to the public, that they actually want to sort out the problem. Not true! Be warned: When you contact them they insist on not giving your money back, but insist on this useless ‚Äûcredit shell‚Äú as the only means to settle. This is against the regulations in India. title: Unethical Airline
text:
I hope I can give a negative rating to this Airline, Horrible experience . I live in Canada and I had booked 4 refundable tickets for internal travel from July end - August. I had to cancel my tickets from Canada because of COVID. I had my money refunded from that Airline, but Spice jet refuse to do anything about my internal travel tickets. They just know how to take advantage of the situation and make money. Very unethical Airline, who does not adhere to their own policy. We pay extra money to buy refundable tickets as we are unsure of the future and Spice jet take it as a chance to make money.
They are not giving me an extension either. 
I have been a long term traveler with spice jet while I was in India, but with the current situation THEY ARE THE MOST MONEY MINDED AIRLINE WHO IS TRYING TO LOOT THE TRAVELERS AND TAKING TOTAL ADVANTAGE OF THE SITUATION. title: Shady Business
text:
Well, this flight never took place as the route was cancelled by the airline. However, the way this situation was handled should be a warning to anybody intending to book SpiceJet.
In the cancellation email the airline claimed: "The entire amount (for the booking) will be maintained in a credit shell". There was no option for a refund; just this obscure "credit shell".
I re-booked the flight via Delhi, used the "credit shell" and paid a surcharge for the two sector flight with my credit card. 

Unfortunately, I had to cancel this flight and asked for a refund on my credit card. 
SpiceJet is denying to give this refund. Reason given: "You paid with a credit shell". Explaining that the "credit shell" (which, as I had to find out, is rather a time-bomb) was not an option I was given when the airline cancelled my original flight, does not count. The refund on the credit card is denied. What a shady business!

That there are other ways to conduct proper business was shown by VISTARA, the new domestic airline in India. I also had to cancel one of their flights - and within two days my credit-card was credited with the amount.

THE BATTLE IN THE AIR WILL BE LOST ON THE GROUND.

For me one loser is clear: SpiceJet and its victims (customer would be the wrong world)

text: I have to say, out of all the airlines I have traveled in, which is a lot, SpiceJet was the absolute worst airline ever. To list a few grievances, we where boarded the extreme last, we didn‚Äôt even have place in the overhead bin for our carry on bags, no drinks, and no food at all, let alone complementary hot meals as promised. If you want good customer service and a good flying expirence, PLEASE DO NOT fly on SpiceJet. Extremely disappointed and not at all recommended.

title: SpiceJet cheating and looting customers
text:
Hi,
I have booked a ticket on 20-Jun-20 for 1-Jul-20 however I have not received any confirmation till now for flight number "OE1END".  
  
Yesterday, I called customer care and my call was disconnected by Floor manager.

Today, I had a word with SONAM KUMARI, she was rude, unprofessional and she disconnected my call. 

When I called customer care they said the flight is cancelled as per Government instructions when I requested for the next direct flight they offered me a flight ticket for 1st of August without assurance that flight will not be cancelled.  

And the second option offered by them is a connecting flight via Delhi. Why should I go choose a connecting flight, when I have already paid for direct flight.

Moreover, when I agreed for a connecting flight they are asking for an extra Rs. 3,000. This is how they are cheating and looting customers.  

When I requested a refund they straightway refused to refund and said they can not refund money in my account, the amount will be transferred in the credit shield. 
Why should I accept the credit shield ? I want the money to be refunded in my account.

Aside Consumer count and repeated Tours & travel Minister,

Please look into this!  SpiceJet airlines is using COVID 19 as an opportunity, they are blocking customers' money in their account.

Average ticket cost is Rs.6000
daily impacted customer count is 2000 to 3000
Average money block is Rs. 1,80,00,000

Regards,
Anshul Sahu

title: Spicejet is Cheating customers
text: I had booked two tickets to Bombay from Mangalore for my daughter who was going to Bombay to join medical services. The first ticket was for 25, June 2020. I booked another ticked for 29 June 2020, thinking that if the 25th flight is cancelled, she will at least get the 29th flight. The very next day after the booking, the Spicejet texted me to say that both flights have been cancelled. That is very well, it is their call. But they are refusing to refund the fare, saying that the payment I have made will be held in credit and can be used to fly any time withing 21 March 2020. Well, that is not convenient to me and I want my money back. Spicejet is committing daylight robbery and the government of India is watching mutely.

title: SpiceJet not refunding amount

Now the flight got cancelled due to extension of lockdown till 31st May 2020 and the airline and travel agent is providing me credit voucher/ shell of the actual refund amount with prior conditions applied. Now in this scenario of global crisis I am not sure about my future travel plans and need the refund amount back in my account in original mode of payment. title: Very dissapointed customer
text:
We had a booking for the 26th March 2020. We were called a couple of days prior to our flight to be offered an upgrade for an additional fee which we accepted only to find that our flight was cancelled. After contacting spicejet through their website I was offered 2 options a credit note or full refund. I selected a full refund. I have since been in contact with Sachin Kumar via email who keeps replying with autogenerated messages saying that I now have a credit note which I have to use before the 28th February 2021. I tried to explain that I am not an Indian citizen and will not be able to make use of the credit note by then to which he simply replied that it would automatically expire if not used by the same passenger by 28th Feb 21.

I feel scammed by spicejet and have received no joy from trying to contact them to resolve this matter.

title: Horrible
text: I was visiting India from USA in   Feb/ March. 2020. Had booked  a flight to tirupati  from Hyderabad on spicejet ( SG 467 on 29th Feb 2020  Hyderabad to Tirupati seat no 1A&1B) I was looking forward to this flight as I was super excited  about going to Tirupati . But the  minute I  boarded the flight the excitement had turned into anger. I saw an old  arrogant man seated on seat 1D  treating the crew as if they were his personal servant.  Soon the boarding was completed and the doors were closed. We started taxing towards the runway and  then this  rude man gets up from his seat  as we are taxing and  starts screaming at the crew who were asking  him to sit down as we were about to take off. He wanted the pilot to turn back the aircraft to the gate to pick up his grandson‚Äôs stroller as he had got some text from the airline  about his grand child‚Äôs stroller been offloaded( by mistake by the airline) at Hyderabad. He was shouting at the crew and threatening them about  getting them fired their job as knew some minister . The crew assured him that the stroller would be delivered by the next flight  which was in the evening but he wouldn‚Äôt take no for answer and wouldn‚Äôt sit down.He was creating huge  scene.At  this point I am thinking that the airline would take some action against him which normally every  airlines do with  such passengers, that is to offload such passengers  from the aircraft but to my utter surprise the pilot decides to head back to the gate to get the stroller because he was some ministers chamcha. So  we came back to gate and the ground staff asked this man for the boarding pass and the stroller claim tag. That old man did not even attempt to look for it. Instead  he again starts bragging about knowing some minister and how he is going to make sure that the ground staff would loss his job simply for asking. Staff member was only following the protocol of the airline. I was so put off to see the airline bending backwards to please this one minister ‚Äòs chamcha ( couldn‚Äôt come up with a better word to describe this abnoxious  old man) and delaying the flight by  more than an hour  for all the other passengers, and the consecutive flights that aircraft was suppose to do for that  entire evening . The crew did not bother  to apologize to the other passengers on board the flight for the delay.Very, very disappointed by the airline  and the pilot for taking such a decision. Not sure if I would ever fly an airline that dances to the tunes of ministers goons. A country where prime minster Modi doesn‚Äôt give any such privileges to his own immediate  family we had people like this man who get away with such nonsense because of airlines like spicejet believe in catering to minister‚Äôs relatives and chamcha . I am attaching photo of the old man responsible for diverting our flight back to the gate to get his grandson‚Äôs stroller. I would like to thank the pilot and crew of this flight for bending over backwards to fulfill one man‚Äôs demand. Beyond pathetic.

title: Promising Flight

title: Dileep Kumar Mattoo
text: I happen to be a regular flier and take trips to various locations.some are official while others are leisure.

title: Unprofessional, Non Hygienic and Less customer friendly.
text:
Aircraft and the crew was below average and cane be managed for a short trip. Worst part is their customer service with non transparent and manipulative policies. 

In my instance, I had booked a 2500Rs. ticket with no reschedule fee and cancellation charges. 
Due to Covid-19, I decided to reschedule which I was unable to do online.

When I called, I was told 
- Reschedule charges are 5k(new ticket was 4k), when requested for details of 5k. I was told it is standard. When requested the break down details of 5k, person on call fail to give me the breakdown.

 On further inquiry.

- Cancellation charges are 3.5k

So, if you :
Reschedule - 2.5(booked ticket) + 5(reschedule charges) = 7.5
Cancellation - 2.5(booked ticket)  + 3.5(cancellation fee, more than the ticket ... Lol ) + 4 k( new ticket)= 10k.

I hope spice jet can do the math... Instead of manipulation.

Especially, when other companies have allowed free rescheduled due to covid-19 , spice jet is doing there best to fill there accounts with such stupid standard charges.

title: Another example of the ineptness of SpiceJet
text: I previously wrote a review of how SpiceJet refused to refund my tickets even though the government of India suspended visas of travelers flying from Thailand. In a lame attempt at customer service, they responded to my review by sending me to their feedback form. To this review I am attaching a screenshot of SpiceJet's silly and ineffective feedback survey. As you can see, although it gives you plenty of opportunity to rate the "front lines" folks (e.g., at the check-in counter and at the gate), there is NO WAY to give any type of feedback on their customer service representatives who refuse to help you via e-mail. Likewise, this form does not allow feedback on the fact that their two supposed customer service phone numbers NEVER WORK! Cruel callousness regarding the coronavirus pandemic and complete ineptitude in customer service. SpiceJet is a complete joke of an airline.

title: HOW VISTARA IS WINNING THE HEARTS OF THE CUSTOMES
text:
it's with great disappointment that I have to tell in a situation where the world is facing a pandemic the airlines such as SpiceJet is offering a option of change in date as the only way out for the customers.

Let me tell you this was the first time I had booked a ticket of vistara just to experience the services and firstly the customer care service is so well equipped that I don't even have to wait to get connected. On my request the associate just told me one things Mam, we understand the situation and we want you to be safe at home hence we will do a 100 % refund.

I tried calling you since yesterday and today through my sheer luck at 9.45 I got through and was on a waiting line of 52 minutes after which I was connected to Omkar. And this young chap could not do much as the guidelines of SpiceJet is only permitting change in dates without a pentalty.

In a situation of world crisis where the stocks are crashing and we are at the edge of recession all that we need to do is show loyalty towards customers and empathise the scenario. And not just make revenues by hook or crook.

A traveller is making the plan to visit on city for various serious such as meeting and appointments. I am travelling to visit the government of India and I am not very sure when will I get the appointment next month by 30th April given the situation in Delhi and people anticipating only worse situations to come. 

However I am not getting that support from your airlines. I don't travel often In a year but whenever I do I prefer SpiceJet for the efficency in timings. BUT LET ME BE HONEST TODAY I REGRET FOR NOT BOOKING MY TO AND FRO THROUGH VISTARA FOR THE COMFORT THEY GIVE 

And LET ME TELL YOU THIS GESTURE OF THEIRS WILL ALWAYS BE REMEMBERED FOR EVERY TIME I DECIDE TO TRAVEL. 

I am only going to request you to not making money at a time of crisis and support the traveller, it's not like we don't intend to travel but the government has been issuing way to many bans to even operate. It's a time we join together, I understand that the aviation and travel industry is the most hit and the impacts are huge. But let me tell you together if we all stand we may fight this, if not the costs as individuals will be really high.

Kindly accept my humble request of 100% waiver for the flight booked or you can give a credit not with 6 months validity 

I look forward to hear from you

title: Rough!
text: The flight was short but not sweet. The flying was rough, being seated in the middle next to the wing meant getting the "most" of the diesel and to cap it all, the landing was very hard. I don't know if this is something to do with the type of small aircraft used, or the oceanic breezes, but invariably this route is rough. If this is routine - I've experienced this in 3 out of 4 flights - then the crew should at least offer warm towels or tamarind...something to help the queasiness.

The meals are not included but one may buy if they want. It many times reaches before time. View is good since the flight is not driven very high.

The only thing I would like to mention that made me sad was the mishandled luggage. My bag wheel came out broken in the return flight to Jaipur and the bag was also broken from the same side.

title: Surprisingly good!

We had ordered some lunch and they had it ready and it was quite good. The seating, although not great, was still comfortable with good legroom. This was close to a three hour flight and it went smoothly. One of the better options in India.

title: Excellent Service
text:
We were flying to Mumbai from Jaiselmer by 11.40 am flight. The scheduled time for reaching MUMBAI was 1.25pm. I had another one hour journey from airport to reach home.My daughter had an annual day function at her school at 4.30 pm. Usually MUMBAI bound flights always get delayed due to traffic, I was fearing that my daughter may miss her function. However our flight took off before time and reached MUMBAI before time. Best part is our luggage came even before we reached the belt. So we reached home well in advance. I am very thankful to Spice for the excellent service.
Even on aircraft we were treated well. Airhostess Zabin was very courteous and helped us getting good refreshment and also was very prompt in serving it.
We also found seats are very comfortable.

On the whole we had a very pleasant journey. I strongly recommend flying by SpiceJet all the time.

title: Bumpy landing and late
text:
Tuesday 3rd March and we were travelling, from Dabolim Airport, Goa to Mumbai, on board SpiceJet flight SG454.

Our flight was due to depart at 13.30 and arrive at 14.55 a scheduled flying time of one hour and 25 minutes 

While waiting in the Departure Lounge, there was an announcement advising passengers of a revised departure time of 13.50, this was further revised to 14.05. The reason given there was a delay in the arrival of the incoming flight due to congestion at Mumbai Airport. 

We started boarding at 13.50 and pushed back from the Terminal at 14.15 and airborne at 14.25. We actually landed in Mumbai at 15.25, which was 30 minutes later than scheduled.

We did purchase some extras, we selected our seats and paid 1,900 Rupees ( roughly ¬£21) for 5kgs extra baggage.

There was an announcement advising passengers that the flight time would be 55 minutes and apologised for the delay.

The aircraft a Boeing B737 - 800, was previously a Jet Airways aircraft. The livery was partially Spicejet with the Jet Airways 
logo on the tail painted out.

The seating was reasonably comfortable with adequate legroom.

The crew were very smartly dressed in their red and black uniforms.

Food was served for those passengers who had prebooked and paid for it, snacks were also on sale.

It was rather wobbly approaching Mumbai, and the landing was rather severe culminating with a slam on breaks.

An average rating might appear a bit harsh, but a rating of very good would have been over generous.

title: Government School Students first time traveling Flight - PNRNo: IGY2FX
text:
Dear Team, 
                     We really enjoyed with our village school students traveling first time in flight,Spicejet SG103 MAA-IXM,All students are really happy for this flight traveling, Really appreciate and Thanks for Spicejet Team.
 
Head of State  Government Primary School, Mangalam (Sivakasi - 626138)  Jayachandran's teacher, at their own expense, boarded 25 school children and 06 teachers on a SG 103 flight from Chennai to Madurai on Sunday (01-03-2020), giving all children the experience of traveling for the first time.  SpiceJet offers boarding passes for kids for today's special Happiness-flight.  This joy-flight comes close to Sapon Ki Udan, and SpiceJet continues to take children on special pleasure flights at concessionary rates.  
 
This is our first time traveling to our village school student, which is a dream for all children, but this dream came about through our school headmaster and the SpiceJet team travel desk.

 Thanks to Mr.Jayachandran SchoolHead Master And Special Thanks To Spicejet Group Desk Team.

title: Excellent Service with value for money
